Mirai Nikki’s mission statement is one of its more obscure characters. Yomotsu barely has 20 minutes of screen time. He seems at first like an out-of-place oddball with his posturing as a Hero of Justice. This posturing is crucial. He says that the way to know who’s just ad who’s evil is according to who wins.
It’s a blunt way of saying it, but it’s true of many stories. Our hero defeats the villain with brute force, and we know he’s right because he didn’t deliver a speech about World Domination. In Death Game scenarios, it’s even worse. In Hunger Games, Katniss never has to cometo terms with killing innocent people.


The Death Game scenarios are scary because they force people to fight who’d otherwise won’t. Katniss never has to face her fellow players’ humanity. She just happened to face the cruel ones. No such shortcuts are taken in Mirai Nikki.


Everyone is funny in their head, but no one is outright evil. Some are more crueler than others, but that cruelty is explained. We’re invited to understand these characters. Even when the cruelest of them die, there is tragic vibe to it. Things could have been different for them. Reisuke and Tsubaki are characters who made wrong decisions based on their circumstances.


Even John Bacchus, the character who could most easily become a caricature isn’t. He has grand plans for humanity, but not cheap World Domination. We see his plan’s failure in action, rather than have a boring speech about megalomaniac aspirations.


This approach to the Death Game brilliant. Not only it gets why the scenario is interesting in the first place, but it makes it more thrilling. Some have criticized the show for having a cast of stupid and psychotic characters, but that’s the point.


The best thrillers aren’t just a bunch of intelligent people playing mind games. Playing games is more fun than watching others do it, anyway. The best thrillers are those that are concerned with the emotional consequences of the scenario. They create thrilling set-pieces. They use atmosphere, symbolism and visual style instead of constant feedback.


Mirai Nikki is closer to thrillers like Pi and The Machinist, rather than the constant build-up of Death Note. It has a cast of weirdos who are thrown into a scenario with other weirdos and try to navigate it. The thrill comeד not from wondering What Will Happen Next, because it’s interesting to see these personalities clash.


There are not highly-skilled badasses. Since they’re all emotional wrecks, that makes them unpredictible. We can expect an intelligent person to come up with a solution, but we’ll never know when a regular person will act on his rationality or on an emotional impulse. Whereas many thrillers just give the characters random skills, Mirai Nikki literally gives skills to the characters based on who they are. A loner is given a diary which records all his future observations. A couple is given diaries which predict their lovers’ future. An owner of an orphan home is given the ability to produce diary owners, like giving births.


If this starts to sound meta, then it only gets worse. Aren’t Yukki and Mur Mur a paralell to the us, the viewers? Yukki was, until the game starts an observer who wrote what he saw but didn’t participate in things. That’s how consuming media often works, especially when you write reviews like these. Mur Mur’s motivations seem like she might be evil for evil’s sake, but her desire for amusement is familiar. Don’t we watch these Death Games stories to be amused, too?


While the Death Game scenario is the main theme the series questions for a while, there are a bunch of other ideas scattered around. Romance is being satirized with Yuno. Her character is more clever than people give her credit for. She’s a response to people’s desire for someone to love them deeply. Yuno’s love is serious, but it’s also selfish. She’s concerned more with protecting Yukki than what Yukki wants, although she matures a bit as it goes on.


There’s also some things about the nature of God. If Deus’ death seems like a giant plot hole to you, then you’re unfamiliar with mythology. Gods die and humans replace them all the time, and Gods are often limited in their power. We also get a Badass Switch, which addresses the topic at hand. Yukki doesn’t simply become a gun-packing OG. He’s suppressing his sensitive self, but still acts on his desire to help others. We even got a Metaphysical Rebellion thing going on. The owners are all given the ability to change the future, yet do they really change it? Yomotasu appears again. He’s being told he will die, so he just kills himself.


Some of them try to rebel, to do something other than become Gods. Mostly, they all go along with the circumstances they’ve been given. That’s the reason why many of them became crazy in the same place. It’s not an accidental detail. The whole Final Battle is one big metaphysical rebellion. It sees the characters trying to create an alternative future.


All of this sounds very clever on paper, but the execution is closer to the violent use of that word.


The problem with Mirai Nikki is that it’s too original and has too much to say. It’s full of ideas and it wants to deal with them on its own rules. We get a few pretty women, all of which spend more time being characters rather than let us stare. There’s an extended sequence where Yuno is in underwear but it never slows down to give us good-looking shots. There are shifts in tone that feel appropriate. Such an overblown story can’t work without some humor. The progress of the story is more thematic than realistic. Things exist and happen because they fit the tone and meaning. Questions like ‘how did Rei get the poison?’ are left unanswered because they’ll most likely not add much.


The problem with creating your own rules is that you’re a first-timer in the game. Digimon Tamers might be brilliant, but it’s the result of past failures. The story is archetypical. The creators looked back on similar stories, saw where the holes were and filled them.


Mirai Nikki has no such tradition to draw from. It borrows freely from School, Death Game, Psychological Thriller, Action and Fantasy. It’s both excited by what it has, and unsure of itself. That’s why the pace is too fast, but the series never runs out of stream even when it’s off the rails.


Normally I’d complain about a few unnecessary episodes, but this one needed more. The characters all have quirks that point to a personality, but that’s all they do. Their defining features are too often external – a tragic event in their past, an ill son. We don’t get enough of moments that show us how these things affect them.


They are affecting them enough to feel different. Both Rei and Tsubaki have their tragic pasts, but one is full of hatred and the other is just cruel. That’s a pretty significant distinction. It’s not explored, though. These characters die too quickly.


What made the Cult of the Sixth so exciting is because it threw all these weirdos together. Instead of having boring one-on-one match, we have different people doing their things according to how they see fit. You can’t do it for 26 episodes if everyone is constantly dying. They kept some of them alive for a long while, so why not all the rest?


There is also an added mechanic which might feel like an asspull. It actually fits the theme of the series and is necessary for the metaphysical rebellion thing. The problem is, by the time it appears our story shifted focus. We’re no longer following a cast of weirdos and their plight, but see the metaphysical rebellion itself.


It’s interesting enough, but it calls for a different series. A story ends when its ideas conclude, not when stuff stops happening. In this case the survival game ended, therefore the first story is over. Shifting a focus just causes unnecessary confusion. If they dedicate 26 episodes to their ensemble and expanded the final battle to a short second season, it’d be better.


At least the the series never runs out of steam. From the beginning the show feels like it will go off the rails, and it does. The train keeps going forward though. The track might be lost, but you won’t reach your destination by standing still. Even when it loses itself it refuses to play by anyone’s rules but its own.


There’s something admirable how it keeps going forward. Better anime than it fall to convenience when things get too hard, but Mirai Nikki just speeds forward. If we compare anime to Icarus, then Sword Art Online gives up on the sun and drowns. Mirai Nikki forgets about the sun and tries to fly to outer space, but burns in the atmosphere.


Credit must be given to the visual style. Mirai Nikki features some of the best character design in anime. No one is spared. Many anime have talented designers, but only the women get this treatment. Just look at Date A Live, which has brilliant designs like those of Yoshino and Tokisaki, but Shido might as well be a stick-man.


Here, we have an attention to detail. Yukki isn’t just another black-haired hero but given an actual style, even if it’s less flamboyant than others. Everyone has their own facial expressions, their own hairstyles and their own outfits. It speaks volumes about the series when it creates pretty women but doesn’t linger on their bodies, and finds room for a deformed one too. There’s something beautiful in the picture of the ending theme. We see all the owners’ shilouttes standing, each with his own unique shape.


This makes everything feel so alive. It may look unrealistic. Marco’s hair definitely can’t stand like this, but that’s not the point. Animation is expressing ideas using visuals. Human beings are often weird. I lived with many of them, and few turned out to be normal. Their personalities are closer to Mirai Nikki‘s flamboyant design rather than Mushishi‘s, where everyone looked the same. Now what is more realistic?


Mirai Nikki is full of flaws and little holes. There are       average anime with less obvious problems. There are also not many with so much life and energy, that play by their own rules rather than someone else’s. There is a masterpiece here somewhere, but the pacing is too rushed and there are too many ideas than it can carry. It’s never boring, it’s rarely convenient and it’s always unhinged and bizarre. In this case, I’m willing to forgive the flaws.


The biggest plot hole that nobody talks about is Uryuu Minene never wearing her twintails again. These are the best twintails in the history of anime. Why not use them?


4 blind eyes out of 5

First of all, let me start by giving you the biggest advice of all, putting aside this review, do not listen to any reviews unless they are POSITIVE. Reviews are usually written by people who have a very judgemental personallity and people like that hate things that make people scream out of joy.
Before i started watching Mirai Nikki i read a few negative reviews about it and appearantly, the details of the review were totally right.
However, the conclusion was absolutely wrong, i admit that mirai nikki doesn't do a very good job at what it was meant to be, mirai nikki is not a goodthriller or a psychological drama (except for Yuno who is one of the most interesting characters in the history of anime), and appearantly that's the reason of all the bitching.


Ok so let's actually start this review.


Story - A- : 


The main idea of Mirai nikki is good, it really is, but appearantly this is not what this anime revolves around, the anime's main source of interest is the relationship of Yuki and Yuno, the two main characters of the show.

While being a little reinforced by their surroundings, you'll find out at the end of this anime that the only characters that you really care for are those two, and if you ask me it's totally fine.


Characters -  B - :


Some characters in Mirai nikki are very generic and meaningless, but atleast they don't harm the story, a few characters are well thought of and developed and those are the ones that you are likely to remember.


First of all, we have Yuki and Yuno, which are clearly the most interesting couple i've ever seen in an anime ( Maybe except Kirito and Asuna ).

Yuki is an amazingly well developed character who goes through a logical and major change through the show, you may not really like him at the beginning, but after a while he just does what he has to do and turns the entire show upside down. Then we have Yuno, she is absolutely the main trigger of this show to exist to begin with, she doesn't go through alot of development but that's cause she's already figured out, and you'll find out why later on.

Second of all, we have Yuki's friends, Hinata, some random uninteresting girl, some stupid goofball who keeps making fun of himself and Neon genesis evangelion's tribute.. Akise aru, the mysterious detective guy that you suspect throughout the entire show, sorry for not saying anything about the other characters but Akise is the only one i feel is worth talking about, this character gets little screentime but every time he pops on the screen you're being reminded of why this show is so interesting in the first place, he's the one who's thinking outside of the box and asks himself questions that nobody else has thought asking.



Now, i wanna review something that nobody else reviews and that would be:


Attachment to the characters A+ :


This is something that absolutely doesn't apply to everyone, but if it does apply to you, you're in luck, because you've won a great prize, this show offers the best of the best to people who have a high enough EQ to attach to the characters ( Most people obviously do ), ofcourse i'm only talking about Yuki and Yuno..

You'll find yourself sitting with a blank look on your face, thinking why they are not real when you're finished because they just make the most interesting couple ever written in anime history, and that's because they're so unusual.


Animation - A :


I don't have much to say about the animation of this anime, it's really good in my opinion, if you don't particularly like this kind of animation then it will just do what it's supposed to do.


Music B- :


Not too much to say about the music either... the soundtrack is really forgetable but the opening and ending themes are just classy and cool, especailly the first one ( My opinion ).


Overall B :


I really wanna give it an A+.. i really do.. and that's because that's why i specificly feel about this anime, i've been through a short but amazing ride while watching this show but unfortunately what i like doesn't apply to anyone, everything else i said is pretty much objective so don't worry, just give it a chance ( It gets better after a while, the beginning is not as good, it still is, just not as good, and the rest of the show is amazingly well thought of )


Strong points :


Plot twists

Character development ( To some characters )

Mystery

Attachment

Future Diary/Mirai Nikki is a well written novel-like story.
Future Diary was a suprisingly awesome anime/manga (I watched the anime only). I wasn't so sure about it at first because I thought it was going to be another bloodbath without enough story to justify the bloodshed that was happening/going to happen but I was wrong.
What if you could look into the future just by looking at the screen of your cell? Sounds awesome, right? Well what if I told you that several others also had the same ability but you have to kill each other or else the world will end and whoever is the lastperson standing becomes god of time and space? Shit just got serious now!


Future Diary is an anime I would've dropped by the end of the 2nd or 3rd episode but I was forced into watching it because of the damned anime recommendation circle I'm part of but I'm glad I finished this anime because it was worth sitting through the whole series. To be honest, the realizationg of how good this anime is didn't hit me until about halfway through and Future Diary definitely earned the right to carry the genre name of suspense. This anime had me sitting on the edge of my seat wishing I had popcorn to snack on while watching this psychotic masterpiece. 


Future Diary started a bit slow for me but it's not so much that it's a slow paced anime, oh no, that's definitely not the case, it's just that murder action suspense isn't my cup of tea but the character writing was way better than I initially thought and the anime grew on me.


Our MC in Future Diary is a middle school student named Yuki Amano. Yuki is a loner (and a total wimp too), he records his daily events like a diary in his cell, he also has 2 imaginary friends; Deus Ex Machina the God of Time and Space!, and there's Murmur (assistant of Deus Ex Machina the God of Time and Space). One day Yuki learns that his diary recordings are showing events that are yet to happen and end up coming true. This brings Yuki discomfort and he learns that he is a player in a survival game where all players must kill each other in order to take Deus Ex Machina's place as god of time and space because he's slowly deteriorating.  Yuki (also known as 1st) ends up teaming up with Yuno Gasai (aka 2nd) who is an obvious psychopath from day 1 but she is madly in love with Yuki which causes her to go to extreme lengths to protect the love of her life.


I didn't really like Yuki all that much because he's incredibly wimpy and weak-willed (especially in the stting in which he is placed) however, at a certain point in the story he becomes more confident, badass, likeable, and a character I could root for. Yuno stays psychotic til the ending but over the course of this 26 episode+OVA we learn more and more about our heroine of this story. Yuno Gasai is the most psychotic yandere character in anime I've ever seen but I just couldn't bring myself to hate her (especially after learning why she's the way she is). Honestly I couldn't care less about the characters who weren't chosen as candidates/players. They just weren't interesting enough for me to care about them, the psychopaths were waaay more interesting like the terrorist, the cop, the child, the mayor, and everyone's favorite, Yuno (the MC's love interest).


The story of Future Diary has this brilliant formula that makes an excellent suspense story; plot mixed wth confusion -> problem -> answer to problem in next episode -> new problem -> answer to problem in next episode -> slight explanation -> new problem -> answer to new problem in next episode -> more explanation -> new problem -> answer to problem in next episode -> rinse and repeat. 


The animation is good and it really captures the psychotic looks in the characters eyes.


After the end of each episode there are mini episodes attached on about Murmur's silly adventures and her interactions with certain characters in the series.


I shall not spoil the ending but I will say it has a depressing turn that I couldn't help but compare it to Serial Experiments Lain's ending but with a love plot attached. After the credits of the 26th and final episode, there's hope!


That scene after the credits of the last episode is explained through an OVA that I imagine many people would call the true ending.


This was an epic anime with plenty of unexpected twists and turns and would recommend it to anyone who likes suspense, mystery, violence, character development, psychotic romance, and thick plot. 


So if you're interested, PLEASE GIVE IT A SHOT!

This anime is without a question my favorite.Everything about it is great.The story is amazing and one of a kind, the characters are unique.The soundtrack really sends you into the story, and your heart may explode of excitiment.
   And the plot twists are OUTSTANDING.I haven't seen anything brighter than this pshihological anime. I recomande it to everyone.

Mirai Nikki is one of my favorite manga. the excitement, the thrill, the pyschological factor and that memorable romance was something i thought could not be duplicated. I remember what i said in my head when it was green lit for an anime adaptation :" this is gonna be good"....what i didn't know was it was actually going to be awesome. The beginning of this review is going to make me look like an ass-kisser but there are some very small downsides. 
story- wow....if more words are needed to convince you then i shall continue. We have such a thrilling situation where the concept of"survival of the fittest" comes into place with the reward to be god. Although i have only watched 3 episodes at the time of this review i can say that the feeling i had when reading the manga is coming back in a more visual form. The twists and "oh damn" moments are as lively as ever and leaves you wanting more and more (kinda similar to Deadman Wonderland). I suggest this plot for people who want to spice up their anime list and want something new and original to the plate. 


art- the art is consistent and has great quality. i can't really say that the art is jaw dropping but its clear, beautiful and fits the atmosphere almost perfectly. this is a typical present day anime quality art basically but with more consistency. 


sound- Quality is perfect. There are no akward sounds, and if there is then its nearly impossible to spot. The many situations are accompanied with clear cut sounds and the background music slips in to make the situation more intense or emotional. But to be truthfull all sounds seem to sound the same to me so your taste would most likely be more critical. Also if we are talking about OP and ED then they are great especially the ED imo. unfortunately i am not too familiar with Faylan and Yousei Teikoku. However i have heard them sing in1 or 2 animes i have previously viewed but their impact was not enough for me to remember the name. 


character- here we go. 

1. Yukiteru Amano is a boy who seems to prefer being a side character. At first he appears to be a typical highschooler excluding the fact his hobby of recording things on his phone. thats just sounds painfully boring. He is a more exciting person then you would expect at first....well he better be because he's the main character. Yuki's thinking is quick and filled with overflowing emotions in pressuring times. This is a really intresting point about him that i think you will also enjoy. BTW when i say overflowing emotions i don't mean it has to seem like he has some disorder or an insane case of ADHD. 


Yuno Gasai- YANDERE. by far the most eccentric, bloodthirsty, and intresting character in Mirai Nikki. You will never see another character with Yuno's traits. She has a rather akward and scary crush on Yukiteru which fuels the pychological factor but also puts an new twist in the romance genre. Yes there is some romance but don't expect it to be generic. 


-enjoyment- Yes you will enjoy this. I wouldn't recommend this to everyone but if ur looking for a lil adrenaline then go ahead and watch Mirai Nikki because it will not disappoint. I am still suprised that the adaptation is almost perfect but more suprisingly the adaptors captured the feelings in the manga and successfully portrayed it in the anime. I feel as if there is something missing that could push this anime to a ten. perhaps other reviewers would give this anime the ten but its missing that ulimate spark that i haven't seen for a while. regardless its a great series and it is my favorite anime of this season. 


Current Overall: 9- Right now its at a nine in my opinion. it, however, can change as the series continues. i hate giving out a rating before the anime ends but thats my true rating for now. 


-Dead End-

Editied for up to Episode 12:
There have been a couple spots of relativly lower quality animation scattered in what has otherwise been very good qualty video. - 8
The soundtrack, while it can seem a bit, well lazy at parts throughout the course of the show, still managed to boast both the best OP and ED of the season, from what I watched.The voice actors/actresses all seem to match up with their designated roles, although I may have liked to have heard someone else play the role of Yukki - 8
In terms of characters, well everyone (at least to my knowledge) watches it for Yuno soits actually more practical to talk about the other characters.\n
Yukki really dips between points of being annoying and points where I can appreciate his struggle and how he overcomes obstacles. But the true character strength in this show seems to come from the other diary holders, each of whom brings something new and diverse to the scene, not just with their external character traits, but their back stories and especially their personal diaries. - 10\n\n
The story overall was the first of the genre that I had picked up, so at least for me it was unique and intriguing, although I'm aware some may find certain aspects of it over emphasized by the creators and over-hyped by the fans. Overall the fluidity of the narrative combined with great character interaction with limited, yet useful anime-only fillers, is well thought out and well executed. - 9\n\n
Personally I found it to be my favorite show of the season, closely followed by Fate/zero and assuming it continues the way it is now It will be a show to watch whether you are just picking up or waiting for the end to marathon. Overall Mirai Nikki scores a 9/10

Whew, Mirai Nikki. One of the most controversial anime series to ever air: some hate it with a passion whilst some praise it as a masterpiece. It creates a definition for the terms "yandere" and "overly attached girlfriend" and taught me a new meaning of love. For me, it was a roller coaster ride of a lifetime with so many twists and turns that never bored me for a second and believe me, that is a feat indeed. I believe Mirai Nikki is something worth checking out no matter what genre you like and honestly, if you don't like it you don't have to seeit another episode. Ever.


Story: If you are interested in a long, suspenseful thriller then Mirai Nikki is for you. The story is a great ride through a fictional town with various places including schools, hospitals and towers being explored. Each story arc tells the struggle of one of the minor characters, their background and their reason to fight and ultimately become God. I have learnt many things about being human watching this series and hope you can too. And who can forget that ending? Countless have shed tears watching that. BUT, one of the main reasons this show is hated by many is because there are many plot holes. Sometimes you may find yourself asking "wait, how exactly did that happen?" or "why would this thing do that?" but ultimately, at the end of the day it is your choice as to whether you let these plot holes obliterate your enjoyment of this anime or whether you choose to ignore them as I did and enjoy it anyways.


Art: This anime aired in the 2010's, therefore the animation quality is of course going to be good. However, if you are only looking for good animation, then I don't recommend this series as there are better ones, such as Guilty Crown. However, I do believe the team did a very good job with the animation in terms of the quality of the explosions, crumbling towers and various other special effects. I also like the design of many of the characters, namely the two female protagonists and Deus Ex Machina (who is a character). 


Sound: The BGM in this anime really help to convey the mood of the scenes, especially the "horror vibe" which is what the series is supposed to do, among others such as a romantic one. My favourite OST by far is "Here with you", which is probably one of the most emotional and beautiful soundtracks you can get out there, which plays during emotional scenes between the male and female protagonists. It functions as my lullaby, study music, relaxation music...ok sorry I'm going off topic now. But you get the idea: it is good. OP 1 is also very good, though I am not a big fan of Japanese singing in English, hence not really OP 2, but both ED's are sugoi, especially 2 which really shows the pain of the female protagonist.


Character: Mirai Nikki has a very good set of characters. The cast are a generally likeable bunch, and of course the seiyu of the female protagonist did a very good job voicing her with that high-pitched voice (I do not recommend dub) and rampage voice. the minor characters all get a share of the development, as each of their backstories, their personalities are all told as well as their reasons for fighting. And my favourite part is that they are not all souless, heartless killers: they act like their personalities. And of course who can forget the Yandere queen herself: as stated she gave me a new definition of love and clingy.


Overall, I highly recommend this anime to you guys. If you don't like it then you don't have to keep watching, but like I said there is so much in this anime that you will be missing out on.

Future Diary...
A number of people recommended this show to me, saying that it was some kind of masterpiece. Although I can vaguely see the appeal others may have, here I am to try and prove you wrong. Future Diary is very interesting in concept that falls flat on it's face in terms of story and characters.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Story:
Although we have seen Battle Royale types of shows come out in all types of media beforehand, Mirai Nikki brought on a fairly unique take on the genre. That, however, is the only real praise the show gets in term of story. The writers basically made the show into agory mess, trying to appeal to people who enjoy that kind of stuff. *MINOR SPOILER* For example, you have this 5 year old kid who is apparently taught himself to be some kind of killing genius and can get a hold of poison gas.*MINOR SPOILER END* They litter stuff like this to make the show more flashy than it actually is, which is a major dissapointment in my opinion. Also, like a lot of thriller shows, plot twists are thrown in to make things more dramatic. In this case, however, more is actually less. The plot twists are sloppy at best, and if you inspect them closely, you can see how flawed they are. While I won't spoil you on anything, around the 20th episode, this becomes blatantly evident. This anime just throws in so much random bullshit by the end of it that makes it so confusing that they try to hide the massive plot holes they have created.

 The ending also wasn't much, as it was more or less entirely predictable. In the end, Mirai Nikki was a beautiful premise that failed with, to be blunt, sloppy writing.


*MOAR SPOILERS* One more thing about the story. We have this mess of a romance between Yuki and Yuno. I understand where Yuno was coming from as Yuki gave her a purpose to live, even though that purpose itself was flawed. Yuno never really listens to Yuki or what he wants, and just acts on her own desires. Like, she ties him up midway through the series and keeps him hostage for a short while. Yet, Yuki still, after all the shit she pulls, loves her. I swear the romance is written by a bunch of 2 year olds, but I digress. *END OF MOAR SPOILERS*

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Characters:

If you thought the story was bad, take a gander at the characters of this series. I just couldn't stop shaking my head at the terrible mistakes and lack of backstory they got.


First off, we have Yukiteru. He starts off as a complete coward, scared for his life and not knowing what to do. Because of this, I sympathized with his character for a short while as it added a sense of realism to him. But for half of the series, he just whines and cries about his shitty life, even though nothing really bad has happened to him. Also, when talking about character development, Yukiteru is an example of character development done COMPLETELY WRONG. There are moments where it seems he is finally trying to break out of his spineless cocoon, just to crawl back into it by the beginning of the next story arc. He does, however, start to completely change during the second half. This is also flawed as he changes from spineless wuss into ruthless killing machine over the course of 2 seconds. 


Now, we have Yuno, the yandere for this series. She is basically put into this series to act as the resident badass who Yuki uses as his killing machine until about the halfway point. It was very refreshing to actually see a girl with a backbone, rather than having a useless girl who relies on her damn boyfriend to do anything useful. Still, the dedication that Yuno gives for this crybaby never failed from continuously angering me. I don't see why she has this undying dedication to Yuki, as he really isn't worth stalking in the slightest. 


We are introduced to a vast array of characters, ranging from Yuki's classmates to the other diary owners and so on and so forth. However, none of them except for maybe one or two get any development at all. Some get a minutes worth of backstory, but in the end, it doesn't really help. This is just me, but when someone died, I really didn't feel any emotion towards them, as it just felt like their death was just convenient for the plot to move along. Of course, there is one ray of light known as Akise. He is undeniably my favourite of the series, as he probably gets more development than the main character himself. He doesn't even have a diary, yet hes more useful than him.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Animation:

The animation was good, nothing spectacular, yet nothing that burns the eyes. Some scenes have a sense of style and fluidity which was a pleasure to watch, but some were just really flawed and very static. Also, special mention to the character designs for making the most laugh-inducing characters I have seen in a long time. Like, we have a girl version of the Pillsbury Doughboy. Why the hell...


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Sound:

Let's start off with a good note. The opening. Fast paced, great animation, fits the show well enough. Let's just say I loved the heck out of it. The second one wasn't as great, but it was still enjoyable to say the least. The soundtrack used for the actual show wasn't really anything special, but my eardrums are still intact, so that's a plus in my books. I did have a problem with the sound effects, however, as some did seem out of place, and didn't really fit with some of the actual scenes. In the topic of dub vs sub, sub is definetely the way to go. For someone as whiny as Yuki, you have a relatively deep voice portraying his character, which was terribly miscast. This is also a problem with Yuno's engrish voice actor, for basically the same reasons.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


As much as I wanted to enjoy this series, there was just so much wrong with it that I just ended up shaking my head for the whole ride, just waiting for the train to come to a crashing hault. The story has so many plot holes you could fly a plane through it, the characters either had no development at all, or, in Yuki's case, had too much of it. Also, the decisions each of the characters made where unrealistic and not very interesting in the slightest. There were some high points in the Sound and Animation departments, but nothing to really bring the show out of the rubble that it caused. Although, I know a lot of people will disagree with me, so even though I don't recommend it really at all, feel free to check it out as you might find something to you're liking.

This show makes you never want to leave your phone/diary at home.
You will be stuck to the screen almost mad at the fact you have to click next episode at times because the episode was over!
The characters aren't my favorite characters in the world, but they aren't horrible either. What really gets you hooked though is the overall plot and story line. The art is consistent as well, why it has an 9.
Yes, I have only seen 7 eps so far, but the fact I am writing this early of a review must show that it is a show worth the time if you aren'tsquimish.\n\n
This is a show you don't want to miss.\n\n

Mirai Nikki is said to be a psychological trailer, however it is everything but. It fails to present a feature every psychological trailer should have and that's good character development and strong emphasis on characters emotional state, this state should also be realistically presented. This however, does not happen 
in Mirai Nikki. 
The only way it is psychological if it was a creators idea of using advanced psychology to get a reaction from the viewer and make them angry at all it's flaws, with every episode even more. If it was so, then it certainly succeeds.
The weakest point of this anime, undoubtedly, is it's story.
[Veryminor spoilers to follow]


This story was supposed to be a deadly battle for survival, where no one is safe and everyone could die at any moment. It turns what was suppose to be a survival struggle to a simple shounen series full of plot holes, characters acting irrational, and one of the worst character development I've seen.


I have never seen such plot shields as in this anime. Every character was always miraculously saved at the last second, no matter how weak his chances for survival were.. no matter if their throat was cut, the characters always woke up and performed their final action to prolong the story, build tension, and of course, to earn the author more money with another manga volume, cause if it wasn't for that, the manga, as well as anime would have ended a lot sooner.


And when it was time for the characters to die, they did,  usually in a very melodramatic way, being able to say their final speech.


Their actions often contradicted their beliefs. Some key points to the story were never explained ,the actions of some characters, and even how did they manipulated their victims for example, was never explained later.


Most notable example would be a certain diary owner, and how he manipulated people into doing his deeds by hypnosis which affected hundreds of people, and he didn't even had to look at those people or even be in a direct vicinity, quite convenient for the plot, isn't it? This subject was never even mentioned during the entirety of the anime.


And out of all characters in the story none of them was actually serious about being a god.

Everyone had their motives and yet they formed alliances with characters that they knew would have to die for them to win. And even when they faced their enemies and had a gun pointed to them they'd rather talk and not fire thus almost always letting them escape. And as escaping goes, characters were always avoiding death in very ridiculous ways.


The story continues that way till the very end, with only one episode breaking the streak of the best plot armor example in any anime I watched.


And while the previous episodes might even be considered decent by viewers not demanding realistic presentation, the last few episodes turn the genres upside down as the anime starts becoming mahou shoujo instead of the thriller it was suppose to be.


We then have a girl who can leap for hundred meters with two people on her arms, just like she would be in zero gravity, a little creature who later turns into cannibalistic vampire while throwing magical balls that can also serve as the mini universe creator. 


We have everything BUT realism and consistent, good storytelling. The story also tries to deliberately confuse the viewer at the end so he wouldn't notice all those atrocious mistakes. And in fact for some of the viewers the anime may cause to turn their brain off a little cause of how much is going on.


You could have a great time watching this series, If you don't concentrate on story and just have fun watching, although not believable at all, but quite entertaining survival game and maybe even laugh at some of the earlier episodes. 


And while the anime it is indeed full of holes and doesn't rationally explain anything, the ending is quite surprising. It is not a simple shounen ending. It is a surprising and very interesting ending, for the most part. Of course it doesn't explain almost anything, it simply ends a story. Although at the end there are more questions than answers.


I personally didn't like the idea that they portrayed god in. He didn't have much power and was presented as just sitting there while he had very little to do with the world as it stayed the same place all the time. I mean if he could be god then he could create a world full of peace or completely free of money and boundaries. 

However he either didn't want to or couldn't do it which made being god completely useless and only sufficient for selfish reasons and creating world for yourself only.

Also there's one thing that god couldn't do that absolutely i think don't qualify you as a god, cause as one you should definitely have such powers.


The series shies away from being a strong, gory series and impose too much comedy into most of the episodes.


So as you can read I did not enjoy it for the most part cause I was expected a deathly battle for survival and it turned out to be a full fan-service shounen unfortunately. 

Some people,whose do not demand good character development, may like it, I don't. It's a good anime, for those that likes to have fun just by looking at the bloody action, not looking to much into it's storyline. Cause when you do, you immediately notice all the mistakes and silly coincidences that makes this anime not very enjoyable.


ART:


Animation and background design look very good. It is noticeable that the anime used a bit of CGI for some scenes, especially the ones with Deus but it blends good and isn't very disturbing for the viewer. 


The characters design are very off however, while Yuno and Yukki are drawn very good and naturally, the rest is quite opposite.


Other characters are sometimes just hilariously bad drawn for example eights head being so huge it almost as big as her body, and the hair of ninth makes her look ridiculous.


And a costume for a certain character making him look more like a clown than a psycho.


Those little things really disturb the mood that is set and it's very hard to get back into it once you pay attention to them. Those are a really noticeable things that stroked me. 


Explosions looked quite good and there are a lot of them so if you like this stuff it's going to be a treat for you. Ruined buildings and structures look pretty realistic and it's a very good compliment because realism is a thing this anime lacks the most.


MUSIC:


With first opening sounding amazing and lyrics reciting the names of various gods that as you can imagine ties perfectly into this anime and it was made exactly for it. Red color which is present everywhere in this anime and various gruesome scenes in the OP symbolize that it's a death struggle and it's not going to be pretty. Which wasn't entirely true. All the endings were a good pick, they are used nicely and in some episodes close the scenes with a cliffhanger very emotionally. 


The exception, however, is the second opening for the series. Both lyrically and musically it's one of the worst I've seen and it's definitely one of the worst you could pick for a series like that. Lyrics sound like someone typed some words connected with death to a translator and then randomly put them together. 

They made absolutely no sense. And while nobody watching this in Japan will probably notice, it's horrid for most people who know this language. And certainly it was for me. 


The singer also had no idea how to pronounce English words which resulted in the worst combination of vocals and lyrics I have ever seen in my life. Musically it's not that bad so I wished they just left it in instrumental if they had to use this song. Or better, not change it at all. But they didn't and I skipped it every 

single time. Such a shame.


As for OST it's pretty good although I felt like some pieces being a little too light hearted for some scenes. But it wasn't very disturbing cause there were very creepy and fitting tracks as well, whom I later listened to with pleasure.


CHARACTER:


There are twelve diary owners taking part in the deadly game to become the next god.

And most of them aren't very serious about that.


Yukki was the worst character, or certainly the most annoying I saw in an anime. He's done nothing but complaining the whole time. Even worse, in the first episode he asks Yuno, the girl who is in love with him, to protect him to which she gladly agrees. But that wouldn't be a bad thing, and I could understand there may be such cowards like him, he didn't chose to be a part of this game, anyone would be scared. But he was not only a coward, but also a complete moron.


He tries to form alliances with other diary owners, befriend his friends killers and

acts like the person before him didn't just kill dozens of people "Hey killer, let's be friends?". 


Also he forgives his father for doing a certain thing that I know nobody would forgive anyone for, he does it in one day and expects to be great friends with him. I could understand he was very traumatized and confused by that point, but.. seriously?


This character is a definition of stupidity. 

The way the story progresses around him is atrocious too. 

He is always protected by Yuno, and when certain event happens that makes him change by 180 degrees, it is probably the most forced and irrational change I've seen.


In five days since certain event he now is a total bad-ass and can parachute glide, drive a car like a first class racing driver, shoot a gun so good and so accurate that he can knock out the gun from the person holding it in a way that doesn't harm them at all, he is also a great mercenary with incredible sense of danger and then jumps from a tower with a parachute without fear while holding a girl on his arms, like not frightened at all macho lover. 


Since the change, I couldn't help but laugh every time I saw him.

Or maybe he learned it all from Yuno, who never had no experience in that matter as well?


And speaking of the devil. Quite literally. 

If there's one reason why you definitely should watch this series that is her. 

Being the perfect example of Yandere, she drives this series with every episode showing even more of her insanity mixed with incredible cuteness that is an absolutely pleasure to watch.


She is madly in love with Yuki and protects him  at all cost with anime strongly suggesting that there will be only two people standing alive after all this is over and makes us ask ourself what would happen then. I recommend watching this series so you could find out the answer to this question, as it will probably surprise you, maybe not in a good way, but it's always better than predictable ending, or is it? 


By the end we also find maybe the most interesting and unpredictable thing about Yuno that really makes you want to stay with this anime till the very end. 

It was the only thing that made me watch the whole of this anime.


But, as Yuno is the only character worth watching, the rest is a disaster cast.


Example of others 'very clever' characters include:


There is one guy who gets dressed in the strangest outfit possible who makes him blind and surprisingly he is able to hypnotize people without any explanation of how he does that, until he gets killed in most anticlimactic way possible.


There's a four year old who is a professional killer, of course, and the mastermind, whose tactics are outsmarting every owner out there. For example, he mails himself his diary so that the others would find out and take it from him, but if you open it from the outside it surprisingly releases an incredibly dense gas enough to fill a whole house even though this gas is released from a tiny envelope. It doesn't flow out even though the door is open, oh no, It spreads throughout the whole house making it deadly to breathe. 

He is the master of disguise trying to make his kills look like accidents. And he is of course a four year old trained to kill since the day he could walk by his father Joker (NOT!). 


And that what characters look like in Mirai Nikki, it looks incredibly stupid and you just want to laugh seeing all of them.


And there is a woman whose head is twice as big as her body, It seems there are no limitation as to the stupidity and irrational behavior but there are no limits as to the characters ridiculous designs as well as some didn't even look like humans.


There is also a lovers couple who once they meet with Yukki and Yuno triying to kill them by proving their love is stronger. And when they defeat them both and they are unconscious, the prove they are not serious about becoming a god at all and leave them alive, so you could ask why did they follow them all the way to this point just to leave them alive. Well, I have no idea. Perhaps to make more money for the author by prolonging the story yet again?


And of course there is Deus, the god, whose powers are very, very limited. Well, apparently he is able to pick out his successor cause he is not an almighty god and can do almost nothing a god should be able to and is dying, as god should of course.


There is a little creature Mur Mur, whom we later find out it some sort of demon, or a vampire, who has much greater power than Deus. She can create her own world within a small sphere and put people in it, which Deus cannot.


Also Deus were in talk with all of the diary owners before the game and one of them even designed the diaries himself. You would've thought that would be slightly unfair, to let the creator of one thing participate in the game, he could for example know of some hidden features that others don't, Deus didn't think so however and he agreed, he also gave him the best diary in the game.


No one was really serious about becoming a god, characters were forming alliances knowing that they would have to kill each other at the end, and some were just idiots talking so long that they let opponents escape, and some even missed from 2 meters having characters at gunpoint and so on...


Characters are the weakest point of this anime and this should be an example of how to not create a characters personality. There is only one exception, that being Yuno, but she however is not that experienced as well and yet her knife skills are phenomenal. She makes up for it with her cuteness though so it's hard to notice that for the most part. Shame that the rest of the characters are awful. 


Enjoyment:


It is a horrible shounen and should be treated like one. Do not expect realism or good character development, but if you don't pay attention to this and you just want to watch a blood bath then you will definitely have good fun. 


I didn't enjoy this for the reasons stated above.


Overall:


Mirai Nikki is not a good anime, it tries to make you believe it is, but when you start noticing all the plot holes, all the inconsistencies, all the characters irrational actions and so on you cannot unsee the mistakes in every single episode, and they get bigger and bigger in the end. It is not realistic and believable and can only be enjoyed by turning off your mind and watch characters kill each other without thinking about why they do it.

I couldn't enjoy it and never will. 3/10

The first thought that crosses my mind when hearing the name of this anime is the word weird.
The story is about a boy who gains a diary which tells the future, twelve other people have different types of diary and the final survivor becomes "God". Their version of God is a little different, but it's just basically someone with tons of power to control things etc. 
When first watching this anime, I was definitely sure that I'd rate it no higher than a 7. However as the story progressed the plot sped up quickly I became more interested in the story, but once it gotto the middle of the anime the story drastically slowed down and became slightly boring. What kept me watching the anime was the curiosity of what the end result of the story would come to.


The anime has 

-Psychotic

-Dark

-Creepy

themes.


Story 8/10: The story itself wasn't bad, it's kind of interesting to see how things work out and the idea of a "future diary" is intriguing. 


Art 8/10: Nothing really special about the art. It's not bad, but it's not something that'd amaze you. 


Sound 9/10: The songs are pretty good so is the background music


Character 7/10: At times I strongly disliked the two  main characters throughout most of the story.. Some other characters I found really touching, and momentous but often times the main characters are simply just annoying. 


Enjoyment 9/10: I watched this anime in two days, it was an interesting watch. I don't feel like I wasted my time, it's not that the anime is bad it's just not "blow your mind" type.


Overall 8/10: This anime is probably worth a watch if you're out of anime to watch, or want to save up some episodes on your ongoing series. I would not judge the anime by the first 5-ish or so episodes, because things speed up quickly.

Mirai Nikki or Future Diary is really an exceptional anime. In my eyes, it is a story with so much potential. Unfortunately I think they didn’t used all the potential it had. After the first five episodes I had something as WOW. This is the best thing I ever saw, this is just insane but how closer I came to the middle, the slower the story became. It started to get fillers and things that weren’t as original anymore as in the beginning. Luckily the last episodes became as original as the firsts again. What gave it a wonderful end that is really insane. UnfortunateI was still frustrated of the middle part that is why I didn’t enjoyed it as much as I was supposed to.


The story is about a boy of 14 Yukiteru (a bit background information: They all have god names. I am just telling this because I didn’t noticed it myself back then. The numbers they later get are based on the ranks of those gods, so Yukiteru symbolizes Jupiter or in greek Zeus (who is the boss of the gods). Thats why he is number one) that holds a diary (his cellphone). He has become an observer that take notes of everything he sees. Along with that he has an imaginary friend (or at least he thought he was imaginary) Deus Ex Maxima the god of time and space. On a day after a weird conversation with Deus Ex Maxima about an unknown power, he stands up and was planning to write something in his diary. But he discovers that it is already filled in. First he thought it is fake and that he did it in his sleep or something. But still decided to give it a test but without any expectation of Yuki everything happened exactly as it is written. From throwing a double bullseye to getting the answers of a test he had that day. After that all 12 discovered the power of the diary Deus Ex Maxima took them all together with their bodies hidden as a shadow for each other. Then he starts explaining them the rules. It basically is the last one who survives becomes the new god of time and space. They yet don’t knowing each other's names or faces. They start looking for each other with just one clue their mirai nikki. Already the second day  Yuki was discovered by Yuno (number 2) that has a Yuki diary. But she asked to cooperate with him cause she sees everything what will happen to him while he sees what he will see in the future. So together they have a perfect view on his future. Just don’t forget that nobody can be trust in a game like this and just imagine that someone knows everything you do even before you do.


Guess you can start to understand now why I think it has so much potential. It isn’t just a survival game. It is way more original than that. Especially because that not two mirai nikkis are the same. The way this psychological thriller starts is insane. You know what will happen and only people with a mirai nikki can change that. However when the future is changed that much that you are going to die. The only thing the mirai nikki says is dead end, then you need to change the future as quick as possible. But the biggest problem is that you don’t know what you need the change. Another great thing is that it isn’t predictable at all. You simply never know who is going to die next.


Now this is said you probably have a good idea of the principles of the story. So now I can go further on the other elements. To be honest there is only one thing that really made me fell in love with this serie. That reason is Yuno. She is just the most insane character I ever saw. Her unbelievable love for Yuki, The way she does everything with passion especially killing is so great. She is just a real psychopath that isn’t one bit predicable. She can be the best girlfriend you could ever wish for while tomorrow it might be the baddest you ever had. Yuki wasn’t bad either he just needs time to blossom in a beautiful character while Yuno was that insane from the beginning. Unfortunately things can never be perfect. Because Yuno is such a wonderful well thought character the other characters are being placed at the background and not only that. Because of that they other characters aren’t also well developed and thought out. It is so unfortunate that the best part of the serie causes one of the baddest parts of the serie.


For the rest it has a bit or even plenty of everything. The emotions the serie creates cannot be expressed in words. It is full of despair that creates hope. They can let you feel like two persons. It was the first time I had experienced that I was sad and happy at the same time. It isn’t completely like that. It was actually more that something happened and that I didn’t know how I should’ve felt about it. Even though I didn’t knew what I felt, I knew for sure that the music only made it even ten times stronger. So however I was full of emotion I didn’t knew which one it was. They just mindfucked me so mutch that they literally made a autist of me. The voice acting and the Ost can really do a lot here under the right circumstances. The rest (drawings, excitement) where nothing special, they aren’t bad though.


So it is really unfortunate that the middle was full of boring and bad fillers where the creative level sinks for more than hundreds of meters. Otherwise this could’ve been the best anime ever in my opinion.

Mirai Nikki – A bloody psychological/supernatural thriller. Initially you will no doubt notice similarities between Mirai Nikki and the incredibly popular Death Note, but in the end its completely different.
Throwing middle-schoolers and deranged psychopaths(or in case of Yuno both at the same time) into a battle royale that will decide who will become the next god of time and space – Mirai Nikki is great series, but definitely not for everyone.
Art 7/10
The art of Mirai Nikki is decent, but by no means great.  Animation is not always fluid, there are allot of undetailed objects, and characters are by no means pretty. However the artdirection Mirai Nikki has taken fits the story very well. Its dark, its bloody and psychopaths look like psychopaths(but more on that in character section of this review). As the source material – the manga is not pretty(average at best), the anime adaptation actually improves the characters in my opinion, while staying faithful to the source material.


Sound 9/10


Mirai Nikki’s openings are truly great, especially the first one, they fit the anime perfectly, the animations might contain spoilers but in a way that you will not realise that you are seeing a spoiler. Ending songs, are decent as well  once again first one being better. The OST is also very good, especially during the fights in the last part of the anime.  Voice acting is splendid – especially Yuno, her seiyuu(Murata Tomosa) perfectly plays both her cute and innocent side as well as the bloody psychopath side, I was really surprised when I found out her voice actress only had one other role: a supporting character in Desetsu no Yuusha no Desetsu – after her amazing performance in Mirai Nikki I think we will be hearing her quite often. Other voice actors also did a solid job, but nothing groundbreaking there.


Story 8/10


Story in Mirai Nikki is hard to rate: While early on, and in the middle its really good, the last few episodes are a mess. It feels like Mirai Nikki didn’t realise its full potential, it could have been the next Death Note, The Future dairies that characters possess offer a great deal of tactical possibilities, yet most fights involve knifes, hatchets and guns and little thinking. The twists in the story are really unexpected, but not in a way “I haven’t thought of that!” more like “what? How is that even possible”, there are plenty of plot holes and inconsistencies(especially later on), that you will have to ignore if you want to enjoy the series... and about ending...let's just say it's ... mediocre although the studio didn't have much to work with - manga ending is arguably even worse..


Characters 8+/10


If you thought the story was a mixed bag, then just wait until you read about characters. On one hand we have Yukkiteru – the male lead. He is beyond pathetic with absolutely no redeeming qualities. Its fine if male lead is a weak coward, but he is intelligent, but Yukkiteru is not only weak, cowardly, easy trusting but also incredibly stupid. I guess you could blame it on the fact that he is a middle schooler. But without Yuno he probably couldn’t even tie his shoe laces. Also when you think he has progressed he will go back to his old useless self the next episode. Now the other lead – Yuno Gasai is completely different, she is an amazing character – incredibly strong in a fight, smart and obsessed with Yukkiteru. She kills without a second thought, and when someone or something gets in the way of their relationship she wont think twice about murdering said threat.  You don’t see murderous 14 year old psychopaths as main characters often. The rest of the cast is also great (apart from the “trio of friends from school”, they will definitely piss you off), almost all of the characters have at least a slight mental disorder which is definitely cool.


Enjoyment 9+/10


This is where Mirai Nikki succeeds, an almost flawless victory in fact. Every single episode ends in a way that you will immediately want to watch next one, there are no fillers(maybe half of 2 episodes). I have really enjoyed the series, even with the plot holes and inconsistencies in the story, however if you are the type of person that really gets annoyed when something doesn’t make much sense or you hate Deus ex Machina (not to be mistaken with the character from this series) then it might not be the best anime for you. There is also plenty of gore - this obviously is a good thing for some and bad for others, none of the gore feels forced and I think it fits the atmosphere of the show perfectly so it is a plus.


Overall 8+/10


I was torn between 8 and 9, mostly because Mirai Nikki has many flaws Its going to be 8+. I enjoyed Mirai Nikki immensely, but I can see why people might rate this show 7/10 or even 6/10, it's nevertheless worth watching.

Mirai Nikki is a very exciting anime with a outstanding character named Yunno Gasai.Everybody who watches this series surely falls in love with Yunno.
She alone is one reason to watch this show because she is the defination of Yandre.Other characters also have enough screen time so they are also good to keep show going.
The story is very interesting and keeps you make guessing what happens next.
The story has many twist and turns with enough blood and gore.It can be funny at times but overall it is a very serious anime.
The best part of this show is personal enjoyment although ending was not so nice althoughova tried to cover it.Everybody should give it a try

Pro-tip for watching this anime: Don't try to piece together anything cause you'll be wrong unless your imaginative skills are over 9000!
Story: 8/10
I think that this anime had a really strong story. Basically the story is that there are 12 people chosen to possess a "future diary" which is a diary that is kept on their phones. Using these diaries, the 12 contestants are able to read about the future and what will happen. However, every diary is different as each of them have different things they show. For example one may show if someone is lying and whether they will betray you later whileanother may show you the best way to win a fight (neither of these two examples are in the anime so no spoilers!). As you can imagine, it can be quite crazy at times and you can't really predict what will happen as the diary holders can obviously alter the future to their liking (if possible). Although because of the craziness, there are plot holes that arise but can easily be looked over due to the fast paced action going one.


Now while I did enjoy that aspect of the anime, I didn't find the romance part of the anime too appealing. Usually when you have two people that like each other, more good than bad comes out of it, but in this case more bad than good came out of it and that led to many of our heros dying. Usually because they were trying to save our [pathetic] protagonist that couldn't do jack ****.


Art: 8/10

Nothing too bad. The colors were a little dull sometimes, but yeah nothing that'll kill you.


Sound: 10/10

Yeah everything sounded very nice. I mean everything from the gunshots to explosions sounded fine. Even the sound of someone's eye coming out was *gags* great.


Character: 7/10

OH MY GOSH this had to be the worst part about this anime. Yukki, the protagonist, had to be the most annoying character you could ever think up. You know how in mostly everything it's the girl who's the "damsel in distress"? Well guess what? This time it's a dude. And the person saving him is... yep a girl. And not just any girl, but a yandere styled girl (a person that is overly obsessed with someone else, usually going to great lengths to care for them). Now you may think this is an ok match up, I mean the roles are just switched what's wrong with the girl being the hero? Well did I mention that she's a psychopath on top of being a yandere? Basically when our main character is in danger, Yuno (the psychopath), will run to save him killing everyone in her path without hesitation (because she's a psychopath so it makes perfect sense). And while that's going on, Yukki is crying. Like I swear, every single episode has at least one scene where Yukii is crying and let me just say that this anime has a timeline of a few months. I'm sorry if I'm ranting, but it's quite awful.


Overall: 9/10

Well the show was certainly one of a kind. I kept trying to piece things together, but I always ended up at the same result: nothing. I think that was great as it left a sense of mystery for each episode especially the later ones. If I could change one thing it has, has, HAS to be the main character. He was so bad as the protagonist that even when he was trying to be good he inadvertently killed someone else. But even so, this is a show that will get you hooked and begging for more.

Anime based on elimination games are usually predictable and uninspiring. Mirai Nikki (Future Diary) started out along the same path, but ended up being one of the more successful anime of the year
Story 10/10
Well plotted story. Its like a balance of love and hate. Though it was gory, the story makes you see why it was needed. Also that it makes you want to know how it will end up like despite the killing. A little cute in a way freaky how the obsession on a guy is but pretty interesting .  _ . 
The story revolves around a 14-year-old middle school boy namedYukiteru Amano. Yukiteru is a complete introvert that doesn’t like to get involved with others and even has his own “imaginary” world where he can talk to Deus Ex Machina (a.k.a. God). One day Yukiteru finds that the diary that he has been keeping on his phone is suddenly filling up with entries that predict the future. After narrowly escaping from the hands of a serial killer, Yukiteru finds out that Deus isn’t just a figment of his imagination, but an actual God. Deus informs Yukiteru that he has been chosen to participate in a battle royale with 11 other people that possess diaries that can predict the future. The winner will take over Deus’s place as God of the world. 



Art I'd give it an 8/10 

Since it not that much was amusing they didn't take much detail on each character. Times when they are giving the look upon a person killing someone should look that scary or shouldn't turn away from their personalities, and image. It wouldn't be nice to scared or turn those people off about the characters they love. But the back round,was quite amusing. Nice landscapes .For such an intriguing series, it’s disappointing that the animation quality ranged from poor to average depending on the scene. Nothing really stood out that made me think “wow, this looks nice”, with the majority of scenes being of acceptable quality. Unfortunately, there were a few moments where I thought that characters looked more like stick figures than anime. The animation isn’t essential to the story, but the varying quality level detracts from the overall enjoyment of the series.


Sound 9/10

Since it sometimes wouldn't fit the situation at.Although the OST's were wonderful. But more fit to be on different kinds of situations through out the story.


Character 10/10

They plotted the character out well. On each and everyone's personality. Was very much clear if this was the killer, or what ever is up your mind. Times like this leads you to make conclusion or then making references.

The personalities of the characters are definitely a strong point of Mirai Nikki. While Yukiteru is uninspiring, all of the other participants in the battle royale have some kind of quirk that makes them unique and interesting to watch. For example, one is the leader of a secretive cult that treats her like a god, while another is a young terrorist. Mirai Nikki doesn’t just leave it at that though, as most characters are given a descriptive background. The cult leader was once gang-raped by the very people she’s leading and the terrorist was orphaned in a war zone, leading her on a personal crusade. The most interesting character is by far, Yuno. She isn’t your typical head-over-heels in love girlfriend, but a psychopath bent on destroying anything that comes between her and her love. Yuno is the very definition of a yandere, which is someone who is so in love that it causes them to act in extremely violent ways.


Enjoyment 10/10

With no doubt will end making you wanting for more.

Everyday craving another yet interesting episode. Too bad theres no more season 2 :P


Overall is an 10/10

One of the striking things about Mirai Nikki is that it has no reservations about using extreme violence. Those looking for action will find plenty of it here. There is everything including stabbing, mutilation, guns, poison, and explosions. What makes it even more shocking is that most of the characters are still underage. The extremes to which the children in Mirai Nikki will go to achieve their goals is disturbing but it’s what keeps you on the edge of your seat through the series.



If you don’t mind some inconsistent animation and want to see some bloody action with a good plot, then definitely check out Mirai Nikki.


By the way theres an OVA-ish for those who have finished Mirai Nikki. Called the Next project showing around the month of June? Or April.
