Thank you for taking your time on a newbie such as me on reading my review for Mirai Nikki (TV) ;) Good day all

Mirai Nikki is the anime that made me realize how amazing japanese animation can be. Although, it's not as enjoyable for everyone. For say, if you don't like death and gore, chances are you won't like this anime, but without further ado, let's start the review.
Story - 8/10
To do this anime justice, you really need to look at the story in two parts, concept and plot. The concept of the story is actually amazing, basically twelve humans are given devices from the god of time and space, Dues Ex Machina, called "future diarys" that allow them to see up to 90 days into the future.Then, as explained by Deus, he is nearing his death and commands the diary holders to kill each other in a survival game, and the last man standing becomes Dues' replacment. This sounds great on paper, but as the story starts developing after gradually going through the anime, it feels as if it's just pushing you through a pile of cow manure and at the end is the largest peice of shit you've ever seen, the ending. I won't spoil the ending, but i'm going to say you WILL be dissapointed, and the stupidest part is that the OVA, Mirai Nikki Redial, I presume is there only to fix the shit ending, and THAT is still bad aswell! To sum it up, if you liked the concept, you will still enjoy the series and be able to get enjoyment out of the later episodes. BUT, if you don't like the concept, you might as well drop it before reaching Episode 10. 


Animation - 9/10

The animation looks great, the characters look great, and the blood sure looks great! And that's great, because you'll be seeing alot of blood! That's really all I can say for the animation, it's great!


Sound - 10/10

Mirai Nikki's soundtrack is phenomenal. Opening 1 sounds amazing, it's fast, catchy, and is something I could listen to for hours without wanting to bash my head in AHEM Caramelldansen AHEM- Jokes aside, Ending 1 isn't as catchy as OP 1, but it definetly is pleasing to the ears. Opening 2 is my favourite track of the bunch. Yes, I like it better than OP1, mainly because it shows off all of the diary holder's powers. Sure, it's not as fast or catchy as OP1, but I'd rather sing this then that. Ending 2 is the worst track, just because it dosen't feel like any of the other songs at all! Overall, the sound really is amazing. 


Characters - 10/10 

The characters are BY FAR the best thing about Mirai Nikki. Aside for the cowardly main character, Yukiteru, all of them are likable in one way or another. And there are ALOT of characters, so your bound to find one or two you like. I mean, Yuno is a murderous psychopath yandere, Fifth is a five year old who has access to poison gas and other deadly weapons, Ninth is the best terrorist ever, and Twelfth (My personal favourite diary holder) basically thinks he's a superhero of justice, and that's just to name a few awesome characters!


Enjoyment - 10/10

Aside from the bashing I did on the story earlier, you will find at least something to enjoy about Mirai Nikki. Please, give it a chance, even if the story turned you off. 


 Overall - 9/10

Like I said before, Mirai Nikki is the anime that made me like anime, and there is a reason why. Maybe it's because i've always liked shows with alot of characters, or maybe it's because I like gore. I really hope this review made you at LEAST interested in Mirai Nikki, and to be honest, all of the great things about this anime probobly will pull you through the bad story in the later episodes. So, with that, thanks for reading! 


P.S: This was my first review! :D

This review should not be read before completing the anime since it contains a lot of spoilers.
The setting of this anime is very well described in the very first episode. Twelve contestants have been selected to participate in a survival game where the winner becomes the next god. The main element introduced is the usage of diaries that can predict the future. The idea is incredible and it drives the anime really well. Diaries being put on mobile phones works very well in a way that it allows them to easily blend into modern society. Future being accessible, but varied with the interference of otherplayers, gives conflict between the users a lot of potential. The life-link between the user and the diary adds some thrill as well. 


In the several opening episodes, future diaries were utilized well during conflict, especially for combat. In the early stages of this anime combat feels very rushed. Going into the middle of the series, future diaries don't appear as a crucial component to winning the fight itself which completely bashes the logic behind this anime. Strategic diary usage is suddenly replaced with Yuno's crazy instincts and reaction times which yes - can be completely justified after watching the whole series, but make cruising through the anime a lot less enjoyable.


Characters which you might deem important are being killed within seconds. A chunk of contestants are eliminated very fast which makes them feel more like pawns than characters. One would think all the emphasis would be focused around the competition, when side characters end up being more important for the series than most of the contestants themselves. From a perspective of a viewer that does not yet know the whole story behind Yuno, some actions and decisions were completely unexplanatory. Foreshadowing of her character has only been very slight and the truth being more gradual would surely make this series more enjoyable. On the other hand, her being a complete lunatic obsessed with Yukki actually works surprisingly well in the end. The way she took Yukki for granted right from the beginning illustrates that quite well. She carried the whole show since Yukki was too busy being a complete coward. 


Now Yukki's character progression has been pretty much non-existent. His motivation for friends has been justified by not having any during his school days, when all he truly needed was protection. You'd expect his confidence and independence would rise throughout the series. They only appear as occasional spikes and happen in the presence of others, which makes him a character completely unable of being independent. The source of protection he was receiving never truly mattered. The choice between friends and Yuno has always been the one which appeared safer. In a situation where Yuno locked him in, he trusts his friends more, and later he ends up killing them himself. Main character being completely unable of becoming more confident makes going through the series quite unenjoyable but it somehow feels crucial at the very end. Also, the fact that Yukki wasn't utilizing his observant nature felt very disheartening, i.e Yuno noticing there were no starches on fake phones.


The 4th was shaping up into a what seemed to be a really impactful character. I felt like the police would have been a significant factor since the character would represent the police, he was a diary holder that had an army on his fingertips. It was really sad to see this character go completely insane and get eliminated, after which the police completely loses any function in the series despite all the chaos and murders happening. Minene Uryuu, the 9th, was a really great character. She changed significantly after getting her eye stabbed tough. Her past is explained quite well and she goes from being a crazy terrorist to realizing the game and situation she's put in. She was the only character that stayed true to her spirit and motivation. Her progress is very natural and she takes a role of a really stable well-rounded character.


The frames are really well-drawn and they show a lot of detail while the the animation did not have the chance to shine apart from the last few episodes. There isn't much memorable music played apart from the emotional piano theme and the violin battle theme which are definitely quite significant. More often it felt like music was used as a filler to the sounds. A lot of sounds that lean towards horror have been used in this psychological thriller, which matched the quick bursts of movement nicely.

Humor in this anime series was handled pretty well. It holds a few memorable humour scenes most notably the one where Nishijima is very direct about his relationship goals with Uryuu. Anime humor does not appeal to me most of the times, but there were a couple of scenes that were pretty funny. I thought the addition of murmur in a from of a sketch at the end of the episode was amazing since it works as an optional addition. You can focus on anime when shit gets serious if you don't like the moment being spoiled by humor, which you can easily get back to later. Additionally, closing scenes with murmur provide some minor explanation of all the characters making your understand them just a tiny bit better.


All in all, it's a series that will blow you mind away and make you rethink everything that happened throughout the series, but I feel like there wasn't enough effort put into making episodes more enjoyable. A lot of optional conflicts have been very shallow and the tense parts ended way too early. The story line midst series can be summed up as Yuno being psychotic over and over again. Most of the emphasis was put into the grand final, making the story lack some progressive development.

I came to check out the horrifying theme this show has that I keep hearing about. Turns out, people weren't wrong. First few seconds and it's already something gruesome.
Honestly, this show is really confusing from start to end but luckily I have decent deduction ability so I was able to catch up with the plot. Still.. confusing though. I haven't really seen other series that have a similar plot to this so it's somehow a bit unique for me. Still.. I really can't seem to describe this show or find something else to say about it because I was kind of lost the whole timeI was watching it. Though my expectations were met and I now understand how the story goes, I still have that hint of dissatisfaction left in me. I can't exactly say what this series lacks but I think there is a lack of depth in the plot and story progression. I also thought that this series was a bit rushed even though the pacing was mostly adequate. I don't know if this show was great or kind of disappointing in general. Although I can see the amount of effort put into this and that is why I gave it this rating. I also can't say that I enjoyed it because I didn't get quite a grasp of the thing this show tries to say. \n\n
With the 4 genres that this show is tagged with: Psychological, Supernatural, Thriller and Mystery, I was kinda expecting great excitement that will kill boredom naturally but it seems that they were not properly blended with each other and therefore came out a bit wrong. The supernatural genre was pushed a bit too far with this show and it's like it forgot what reality was. Although the story gets progressively intense and it seems the thriller part went well with this. I was also wondering why it had the element of shounen having the characters with those kind of mindsets. But then this show is clearly not for kids. The amount of nudity here is something not even ecchi series can't offer and the violence can be compared to those horror titles. One thing I can appreciate from this series is the omake in every episode helps release the tension acquired from the progress in every episode. I guess that's the only part that I enjoyed from this. Mirai Nikki had its upsides and downsides but I guess I can now see why this show made it to become one of the popular ones out there. I do recommend it to the mature audience because I don't think kids can handle this stuff.

EDIT: So, on reading this review after awhile, I realize I'm being a bit mean (actually really, really mean). It's purely hyperbolic. While I can't say I enjoyed the show, please keep in mind I bear no ill will towards anyone involved with the production of this show (creating an animated show is extremely difficult, and I have nothing but respect for those who work on one) even though that's how I may come across in this review. The meanness is just me trying to be funny. 
I hate this show. It is without a doubt, one of the worst anime I have ever seenand I have no clue why people like it. Calling this show a travesty, a complete mess or an abomination would be too kind. BTW this review is going to be filled with spoilers from the show. Not that I'd ever encourage anyone to watch this...thing. 


But hey, I'll be fair. Let me start with the 


THINGS I LIKE:- 

(+)um...............it has a nice premise. Yeah, it's a battle royale with the players having the ability to read their future. Too bad the potential was squandered by the terrible writing but yeah, the premise is good. 

(+).......................................................oh yeah, in one of the episodes there is this white-haired gay dude who creates a strategy to defeat an opponent and this strategy makes sense. Too bad it's the only thing that makes sense in this entire "series" and the rules this strategy took into account for only mattered in that one episode, but yeah, that was there 

(+)and um..................................................................................................................................................

.............................................................................................................nope, that's it. 


So, thanks for reading my review, fans of Mirai Nikki, and please leave your wonderful, smart, positive, constructive criticism which........oh, to hell with it, I'm going to be killed anyways. 


THINGS I DON'T LIKE:- 

Everything else. I'll just get the animation and sound out of the way. They were the only decent things in this entire show. I did not find the animation to be anything great and I don't remember any of the songs apart from the first opening. I won't say I hated but I definitely did not like them. There was CGI in the show, and it looked terrible. Some of the animation was rather clunky. Some scenes with a lot of blood and gore had a very light colour palette which felt off. Character designs were alright except for a muffin lady who probably had it's origins on toilet paper. As for the sound, I've forgotten about it. Nothing else to say here. 


So apart from that, what is it that this show does so wrong? 

(-)The Premise So the start of the show is that there is this Shinji Ikari clone(albeit without the depth and struggles) who always writes has daily events on his cellphone like a diary and has an imaginary friend and one day he finds out that this imaginary friend of his is actually The God Of Time And Space and he has chosen twelve or thirteen or some number of people (including him) to fight a battle royale to the death where each of the participants' phones have the ability to show them text messages about what is going to happen to them in the future. So does that mean that every single one of them had to imagine Deus ex Machina(I'm not joking, that's the god's name....probably a symbolic representation for what the entire show is about) the exact same way? Seems kinda weird some of them would even have imaginary friends considering that even the police captain and the mayor of the city are involved. How are these guys selected? Are they chosen at random or does the god choose them? The reason I bring this up is because... 


(-)The Participants Some of the participants include -an antisocial boy -a chick who should be in an asylum -that muffin lady who would normally never hurt anyone -a cult leader who never leaves a room because she has bad eyesight(instead of wearing spectacles) and has been molested by cult members as a child -a five year old (not a typo....for real) -an atheist (whose first act as god is to kill anyone who believes in god) But hey, he's a god, he knows everything. He also knows that setting a death tournament to decide the next God will result in the winner being of sound mind and body with positive ideals and good thoughts and values. The only thing the writers had to do in order to make it a little more sensible would be to make the god a god of death. Thus, it makes more sense for the participants to kill each other. I mean, the god of time and space doesn't do much to influence either of these things in the whole show. 


The thing that makes this whole thing worse is how retarded the characters behave. Firstly, every one of them goes against our protagonists instead of ever fighting each other. There is also a rule that says that if one breaks the phone of a participant, that participant dies. Which is something our characters will do only when the plot calls for it and it will always be in favour of the protagonists. There were so many instances where the characters could easily get rid of their opponents but unfortunately there is something else going on inside their heads. Things got to a point where one of the villains (i.e. everyone besides the protagonist, because everyone ends up betraying the protagonist) is actually able to get the protagonist's phone, but instead of destroying it, he waits until the protagonist arrives at the scene and then gives the phone to the protagonist's father, and asks him to break the phone! Thirdly, everyone has a Future Diary (that cellphone) but they will only read it when the plot calls for it. If any of you do a dare where you have a glass of beer every time an incident could have been avoided if the characters had just looked at their f*king diaries, you would probably be dead within five episodes. Unfortunately, there are more pressing matters for the characters to undertake such as going to school right after you've had a near death experience. Furthermore, no one has any proof that killing these people and becoming a God will allow them to do whatever they want to do which is, I don't know! What would five year old's want to do after becoming god? 


And no, the nonsense doesn't end there 

-the chick, named Yuno- a name you may never have heard of- regularly murders people, and she has murdered a LOT of people including SWAT members who were told that this girl is a psychopath. In one of the episodes, she was taken into custody, and guess what, they just let her go. Genius! 

-Yuno's parents used to mistreat Yuno because, and I quote from this anime's wiki, "Yuno's mother was ill and believed she was a terrible wife and mother, and believed punishing Yuno was her only way to earn happiness.. While Yuno's father was objective to his wife's severe treatment of Yuno, he did little to nothing to stop her." Amazing! 

-The five year old was chosen because he is the smartest five year old child in the world. I don't know how smart that is but it appears to be smart enough that the child can order poisons and gas masks the size of five year olds. Genius! 

-We need to find out the identity of a particular diary user. What should we do? Oh, I know! Lets look at stocks! 

-The mayor of the city converts an entire city's phones into future diaries. Oh my god! So evil! Our protagoninsts have to rush there to stop him now. Yuno what that means? Genocide of innocent civilians by our protagonists! 

-Oh no! All phones in the city have been converted into future diaries! What is the reaction of the general population to such a huge event?.......................<no reaction>...........<citizens don't give a damn>

 -Oh no! An apocalypse which is destroying the world has started! And guess what? The apocalypse is only around the ten people we know! I am not joking! There is not a single soul in the entire world aside from these people! 

-And you know what? The master planner of everything was not Deus ex Machina but his chibi assistant who had planned everything, including the love between Yuki and Yuno, the gay detective guy, the mayor and more! And guess why she does it? Because she's having fun! 


And guess what! This is just some of the nonsense that happens in this series. And what I've written down here is merely a little glimpse into it. 


(-)Romance 

Lets play a game here, shall we? At the end of the series, Yuki(the protagonist) and Yuno finally get together. Tell me, what do you think, I thought when I saw that scene: 

a)<Yaaay> 

b)<eh, whatever> 

c)<groan> 


If you thought b or c, then I am sorry, I did not enjoy this show as much as you think I did. This scene I talked about took place in an OVA that was released after the series. And it was something I did not watch as my soul was a bit too drained at that point. And that's because the romance in this show sucked! It was a one sided relationship for 95% of the series and it was based upon the fact that Yuno had an infatuation for Yuki which he doesn't share. And then a part comes where Yuki finally starts to like Yuno. And guess what Yuno does in return? She drugs Yuki, locks him up in a house and force-feeds him inedible food until that perfect day comes, as written in my future diary, where me and Yuki will finally 'become one'! Aw. And if you thought that Yuki(after being saved) now hates Yuno, you are clearly living in the real world which is not something Mirai Nikki wants. No here, after just one episode, Yuki forgives Yuno and things go back to square one. Oh and their next villains are beaten by them because 'their love is stronger' than this established couple's who have good reason to love each other! Amazing, right? And later that fateful day comes where Yuki and Yuno 'become one' and they do! Aw. I wonder what the next logical step will be. Oh, I know! How about Yuno takes out an axe out of her ass and tries to kill Yuki! And the Oscar for best screenplay goes to Mirai Nikki! 


Yuno has no good reason to like Yuki the way she does. But she virtually becomes a slave for Yuki and is completely loyal and faithful to him! She is willing to die for Yuki because she is infatuated to him. She is willing to keep him for days in a stinking room, drugging him and force-feeding him crap just so she may one day 'become one' with Yuki. And Yuki, for the most part, sees her as an annoyance and only uses her to get him out of trouble and to kill his enemies and he knows that Yuno is a psychopath who keeps dead bodies inside her house. They're romance is unrealistic and Yuno needs to be sent to an asylum. 


So there, I hate this show and I would encourage everyone to stay away from it. Unless, I guess, if you enjoy watching terrible shows because you find them funny because of how bad they are. So yeah, I know that my inbox is probably going to be filled with comments telling me to kill myself, but whatever, I don't care. I hate this show and I give it a biased score of 3/10.

****** SPOILER FREE REVIEW******
If someone tells you that he/she doesn't use a phone, you probably entitle that person to be an alien. I think smartphone has become a detachable body part(mainly the memory) of any average human being.
Imagine you have set a reminder "To wake up Jack at 5", but when the alarm rings at 5 and it displays "Don't worry! Jack is dead!”, you will shit bricks. The basic concept of the anime is that only. The story revolves around Yukiteru Amano, a teen introvert, writes all the event that he observes nearby, seconds in and seconds out, in his phone's virtual diary. Hasnot much friends except the god of time and space himself, who is also a part of his imagination.\n\n
Animation quality is very good, available in 1080p (Violent and Ecchi Content Included). For avoiding spoilers, DO NOT, i repeat, do not watch the opening or the ending song till you finish the anime completely. The background scores, OSTs and soundtracks compels you to think more and more about the plot further. Character development is the best thing that you will experience in the whole series(specially a hot overly attached girlfriend). Each and every character has its own importance and uniqueness. You won’t find a single character useless (even for a very less time). Now, the best part, climax, thrill and suspense, which ..... I won't tell you. Go watch it yourself and get your mind blown. Final Verdict, if you love anime like, Death Note, Steins Gate, Monster, etc., do watch it.

"Daijobu, Yukki. I will protect you." - Gasai Yino
[This review is kind of spoiler free]
If you are a somewhat knowledge anime user, you have probably encountered the infamous queen of the yanderes (someone obsessed on another level with their crush), Yuno. She is obsessed with the male lead of the show and wants to keep him with her forever. She may seem like a useless, dumb psychopath, but she is extremely smart, agile, and powerful. 
Now, about the art and the sound. I am not an expert on these two themes, but since I watched a relatively high amount of anime, I can say somestrong points. The art is pretty good since it is very detailed, looks more realistic than the "old school" animations, and it even had some very cool fight scenes. About the sound, the OP and EP songs are fine, and the voices + sound effects are fine too. 


Nevertheless, what truly made this anime stand out is not its plot, which is also very creative and fun for shounen/adventure audience, but the female lead, Yuno, is something the anime industry has never seem before. '


I guarantee you that after you watch this anime, you will never be able to forget about Gasai Yuno and how she is such a yandere. Some may be afraid of her and become afraid of girls, others will love her and want yandere girlfriends. 



and others like me will feel nothing.



Anyway, I recommend this anime if you like a drama/action/adventure plot with a little romance. However, if you do not like a little bit of horror or unrealistic themes, do not watch this. For someone who has no preference, you should try it out.

I'm a type of odd person with odd interests. One of few favorite manga/anime's were Death Note, Code Geass, Gantz, Neon Genesis Evangelion and few others about young character, far from being able of directing their own destiny, obtaining the immense power that is also hardly described in terms of strength, agility or intelligence. Stories that show their struggle with learning curve of how to master it, and not  at seldom learning from their mistakes. Mistakes are made, tragedies happen, people are killed, there are regrets, there are tears, countless moments of doubt and game breaking flashes of insight. But our heroes, same asthe audience knows that redemption may be achieved only through proceeding this, often gory, heart breaking, full of sacrifices and martyr path. 


Story in Mirai Nikki is no different, and it's audience shouldn't expect nothing else but having their minds twisted on this mad journey and hearts tugged at the cruelty of faith. Unfortunately if bright enough to foreseen but never to prevent the events. 


I'm from Europe and my standards may seem different but going through the list of 10/7/7/7/10/9 i consider the story very unique, even more as the majority of the problem escalates even from Godly grasp, but let's leave it as that, i wouldn't wish to spoil too much. Art should be set to 6/10 but i gave it a higher note, purely out of combat at the end of the series, the part that annoyed me the most were Chibi characters, which were successfully ruining the seriousness of the show. Sound was good, often i had a feeling that they could try harder, but it was actually acceptable to listen, and i didn't mind listening to credits at times. Characters were pretty average, actually the only characters which death made me care enough to shed tears died at the end of the show and concerning family matter (which hero? You'll see in show).  Enjoyment? Yes, very! Watching one episode made me crave to watch seven of them at once, so i eat the whole anime in three attempts. It's like a candy You never have enough of. It's much less complicated then Death Note and Code Geass, but it's still worth seeing, and to some even favoring it. 


Good Luck at watching this Anime, i'm giving it a 9/10, and a must see for everyone who enjoys mind games.

Dear diary, 
I always watched anime, even as a kid although I didn't know what anime actually were. About four years ago I found out what anime really means, and one of the first anime I watched as a "full time" AnimeGirl was Mirai Nikki or Future Diary. That's why, in this review I will write about this, kinda special, anime show. 
-Your AnimeGirl
 Plot and Storyline 
Well, the first thing you'll probably say after you finish this anime is:"What on Earth was that?". 
Mirai Nikki is, I promise you, the most psychopathic anime you'll see in your life. But that is exactly what itmakes this anime different from all the others. 

In the very beginning we meet Amano Yukiteru (Yuki), a rather shy and anti-social. Poor Yuki, his only friend is a imaginary god called Deus ex Machina(This is a phrase that comes from the Latin language and actually means "God from the Machine, but never mind, let's move on)-The God of Time and Space. Too bad, this Deus is not imaginary at all. He soon makes Yuki participate in an survivor game where the winner becomes the next God. Here's the thing now. There are twelve contestants, and everyone of them has a diary that predicts them the future, each diary in it's own way. The last one alive is the new God. Yuki was very lucky, because after the game begun Yuno, his classmate, decided to protect him.And damn, that girl has some awesome skills. Now that everything's set, Let the bloodshed begin!

The fact that all of you should know is that beneath every layer that makes this anime as it is you have the core of it. And it's believe it or not, a Love Story. That's right, the romance between the main characters is the "engine" that drives the whole story on. But it indeed is sort of a psychotic love. The romance between Yuki and Yuno is in the beginning rather a one sided love, but after a long "on and off" relationship, and some ups and downs they made it. But don't think of it as a boring love story, it'll definitely be the craziest one you'll ever see. Don't miss it.

Now let's focus a bit on the other contestants. They also made one part of the show, and contributed to it everyone in their own way by letting us know about their past. Their back stories play an important part in the show and make it interesting too. And besides, the more villains the better the show, right?

Mirai Nikki wouldn't be Mirai Nikki if there weren't this many plot twists. That's crazy how much surprise lies in each episode. The makers really did a great job. A lot of anime makers get lost while "twisting" the plot and the result is a mash of unrelatable stories that just confuse you, and ruin the story as a whole. Future Diary is not the case, the story line was not ruined, it was exciting and interesting till the very end.  

Talking about the end, it will take much concentration if you want to understand why everything so far happened. So keep calm, and if you don't understand something watch it again. It is not so hard to understand but it becomes a mash of things that happened in the past, some other dimensions and the present that's complicated alone on its own.

This is in short the story of The Future Diary, or something like that.


 Characters 


Well, if this is not a crazy bunch of personalities. This thriller anime really bombed me with mostly crazy, then funny, irritating etc. characters. 

The important thing about the personalities of the characters is that their diaries kinda reflect their personality, hobby, job etc. 

In this way trough the knowledge of the diary type you can easily guess a part of the diary user, which I found very interesting.


YUNO GASAI is the sickest character ever. Still, I loved her for being like that. She was funny, awesome and always full of surprises. You really never know what that girl's gonna do next. She is also clever, fighting with both strength and mind. A lot of people hate her character because she is a psycho, but there is not a single character that could be compared to her. She looks like a cute, little girl that is possessed by an evil demon that she can't control. One one side you have her soft and caring side, and in an instant of time she turns in a killer machine.Typical Yandere. But the most important thing to tell about her is her ability to love. It's something like this: "I love you so much that I'll kill you so nobody else does". That's really something. Yuno you truly are awesome.  

I literary hate this guy. He is one of the most irritating characters I've ever seen. AMANO YUKITERU or YUKI is a perfect example of a cry-baby. He is a anti-social mother's son who gets scared in a second. He always depends on someone else and hardly gets something done on his own. But, I have to say that he had an immense character development in the end. It was a totally different Yuki than the one we had in the beginning. He becomes a bit stronger and more independent in the end. The thing that made me not hate him that much was the OVA episode Mirai Nikki Redial, whre he...(now this would be a huge spoiler). However, I can't get the similarity between him and Shu from Guilty Crown aout of my head. 


Animation


The animation in this anime is satisfactory. It is not breath-taking but it is good. There are two things that I'd like to commend. Fistly the character look of Yuno. It is amazing how they handled to make her look cute and creepy at the same time. Amazing. 

The second thing is the opening. It is kinda done in an interesting way, and the mix of fastly moving screens and the creepy music were perfect. But it really gives someone the creeps. 


Conclusion


If you like action, fights and thriller you will love this anime. If you want a good love story you will also love this anime. Mirai Nikki has something for everybody. Don't listen to people who say it is just a story about a sick girl that is in love. NO! Future Diary is definitely more than that. It is catchy, interesting and extremely amusing. I enjoyed watching it, I am sure you'll too. MIRAI NIKKI!

Your AnimeGirl

Hmm, how do I start this. Actually, I didn’t like Mirai Nikki before (while it was airing.) and placed it on hold. I was thinking, it was just the average survival game with a grand prize, so I stopped there. But that isn’t the only reason for giving it up. At that time, there were heavy spoilers everywhere, people/fans talking what’s gonna happen next, how they like the ending, what is the plot twist, and everything. Yes, it is a really popular anime and gained fans everywhere. Popularity somehow means discussion and discussion somehow means spoiler. It was stupid of me to read through thembut in the end, I didn’t care. I liked the idea when I learned what’s going to be the ending, I kinda imagined things, maybe even enough for my own fanfiction. after some time, I gave it some thought to finish the anime. So, enough of my own thoughts, let’s proceed to the review. I minimized the amount of spoilers here to be safe.


PLOT – 9.5/10


The plot is neat, though what I didn’t like is they are throwing out too much mystery then suddenly explaining it towards the end. I’m sorry, my brain just couldn’t handle that much. As I said, it is neat. I didn’t really notice any plot holes or maybe I was just too hooked to the story to notice. For a survival game, I found interesting is the feeling you get from the story. It has the potential to bring out the feels in you. And yes, I admit, I cried a few times in several scenes. Also, there are a few plot twists which totally messed up my predictions in the story. I was like, what? The story is quite unique, I would say. There are many overused plots, character stories and backgrounds but this managed to stand out from them. I may have said I didn’t notice any plot holes in the story but the part I didn’t like is why did they have to face each and every contestant. I mean, there are 12 participants and one or two may have killed each other off because facing the others. Though they were able to use that effectively and I realized that the anime wouldn’t be that great if it weren’t for that. So for all the headaches, mindblown, feels, mysteries, plot twists, and everything they gave me through the plot. I gave it back a 9.5/10.


ART – 9/10


I like the art, yes, but I’m still not going to give it a 10/10. I don’t think the bloody scenes isn’t enough for this anime, but I know that’s just me. In fact, I’m sure that the bloody scenes were just enough, it isn’t overused and also not underused. The fight scenes were good though, I haven’t watched some good fight scenes in a while since most are quite repetitive. Mostly you get is an overpowered main character who you know would win each and every battle and sometimes (worse, always) gets away with no scratches. The way they beat the opponent changes though and I’ll give some credit for that. But this time its different, I actually got some thrill from this anime and I liked that. Also, there are 26 episodes in total, just enough for the whole story. You see lately, I feel that a manga’s potential to be a great anime is reduced when it is adapted to just a few episodes and they try to compress the story to fit the number of episodes which I think is such a waste. So anyway, I’ll give the art and animation a 9/10.


MUSIC – 8/10


The music is very very good, in some way. I mean, the OP definitely fits the anime and its plot. Although I can’t comment much on the ED since when it rolls, I start to think about the episode I just watched. You see, I just mentioned that the throw too much mystery at once. I try to anticipate the next events there. Anyways, before we get off topic. I think the background music during several scenes were a huge part of how it can bring out the feels. I mean, the story itself is kinda lonely, but without a great music to back it up, I don’t think it’ll end up the same. I so loved both the two OP, they bring out some excitement like somehow the adrenaline rush. It makes me active, I don’t know why. I’ll give it an 8/10.


CAST – 7/10


I like how they used characters with so different personalities and how they made their background story but I don’t think its great enough for a 10/10. You see, you get a main character who is always dependent. Yes, I understand how he is afraid of killing, who likes to kill anyway. Maybe me, but it isn’t allowed, so… Off topic. I don’t really like his character but he taught me some things I didn’t expect. I was thinking that if I would be the main character, I’ll get no hesitation to kill or whatsoever. I mean, when everything is THAT messed up, what choice do you get? None. But I learned that talking is important and the truth plus the reasons behind the events, will forever be hidden if we only resort to violence. In the end, I liked the main cast despite hating him before since I was like looking at a mirror. Like the pathetic hopeful dreamer I was. 9/10 if that was the only case. But I thought that, how come these people get this kind of background story and yet. Ugghh. There are some things I can’t comprehend. I mean, there are people who I know are powerful enough to win but didn’t. Pure luck or destiny maybe? Nah, it was the author’s decision. Anyway like I mentioned above, main cast meeting each of them and learning their story, was an effective plot towards the ending. Such background story is 9/10 but the cast itself is 7/10. Sorry.


ENJOYMENT – 8/10


Overall, I enjoyed the whole anime. It lasted in my brain for quite some time and I know for sure that the lessons and stories will be in my heart forever. Yes, I’m quite serious in that and not just being cheesy. I mean, it managed to slip into my dreams so this anime may have been special to me. I watched it continuously with such excitement and happiness so I can’t deny that I really enjoyed this anime. With all the anime that’s been aired and airing, some just leaves a special mark in history and I give this one a nice thumbs up for that along with the anime which I really enjoyed before.

Be ready to listen to the name 'Yuki' during the whole episode, in all episodes.
I really have no idea how I managed to finish this anime, even though I really enjoyed the story.
I found the anime story really good and enjoyable, the kind of anime that makes you watch an episode after another because it makes you curious to know what is going to happen, so if you're looking for something to make you intrigued, this would be a great option.
There's only one negative part for me: both Yuno and Yuki are so, like SO ANNOYING to a point I almost felt like giving upwatching it. They are the type of characters that makes you say 'oh not again' whenever they show up in the series, and since their are the main characters, sometimes it's difficult to watch they doing the same things and saying the same things over and over and over...\n
Yuno is supposed to be the misterious badass girl in the anime yet she's so predictable and meh. \n
If you can stand both of them, then the rest is pretty awesome, but those two really ruined what could be one of the greatest anime in this type of genre.

I decided to watch this based on the recommendations seen here on MAL.  After Steins;Gate I was looking for something kind of on par in terms of weirdness, and I got a LOT more than I bargained for here.
The basic premise is, the main character Yuki - for reasons I won't get into - is able to see future events via his cell phone.  Using this, he has a chance at becoming a god.  That's all I'm saying, from here you can guess why there may be conflicts with this, and where some of his enemies may sprout from.  I wasvery cautious with the reviews I read, and the whole series was just a complete surprise to me.  


Something this show did well was leading you into thinking one direction, then taking you somewhere else.  I don't know if I'd call it plot twists, but they're just simple explanations that you may not have considered.  That said, the scale of the story is pretty ambitious.  So it retains a balance between simplicity and complexity that kind of leads you guessing what's going to happen next.


As far as just small enjoyment, there wasn't an episode where I didn't utter "What the hell.." during.  Not all the turns this story takes are huge revelations in terms of the overall plot, just subtle events that make you feel very uneasy that may or may not come back to haunt the characters.


The visuals were overall pretty great, I can't say I have any complaints in that regard.  One thing I have to say is the initial intro is probably one of the best I've ever seen.  There wasn't an episode where I wanted to fast forward through it (until it was updated of course).  This goes along with my comment on the music, which absolutely leaves an impression.


Overall, I'm very satisfied with this show.  It may not be everyone's cup of tea, but I enjoyed every minute of it.

Many people are surprised when they see how I "averagely" I rated Mirai Nikki. After all, it's managed to obtain a huge amount of fans, especially for characters like the "lovely" Yuno Gasai. And it's not for nothing; the series has a very original plot that I can't say I've seen before even if it's, in its most basic form, a last-man-standing sadism game, similar to series such as Battle Royale.
Anyway, so, why the bad rating? Simple. The characters. They are among the worstly developed and most unrealistic characters I have ever witnessed in any anime and/or manga. Funny considering what attracts the most amountof viewers is actually the characters, namely Yuno and Minene, and dare I say, sometimes even Hirasaka (also known as the weird Power Ranger with a balloon for a head).

I feel the need to explain this better though, mostly because otherwise I'll be bashed by fans on how the characters are extremely well developed and have amazing psychological facters well explained in the anime. Well... that's false. 

Why? I'll explain it character by character. Do not worry, I'll warn if there's gonna be a spoiler.

Okay, let's start with the fan favorite, Yuno, one of the best characters in the series indeed. The fact that she's a psychopath-stalker hides well behind the charade of her meek and cute character, and the events behind why she's insane make perfect sense, after all *SPOILER ALERT* you'd have to have an amazing mental fortress to be able not to go crazy when your crazy mother sticks you in a cage without food just because. *SPOILER END*

Yuno, honestly, I don't have TOO much of a problem with...

But now it's time to get hardcore. My favorite character is Minene, because she's just an awesome badass. Problem; she's a terrorist bomber. A terrorist. She kills innocents just because, and at the beginning of the series kills pretty much all of Yukiteru's classmates except for a couple lucky ones... yet afterwards everyone seems to forget the fact that she's a terrorist and she becomes a cute/badass tsundere... while she's awesome, that's a ridiculous flaw. Also *SPOILER* the fact that a cop falls in love with her and marries her despite her being a mass killer is just laughable. Also, that she has plenty of chances to kill Yukiteru but doesn't for absolutely no logical reason is yet to be explained o_O *SPOILER END*

I've really elongated this a bit too much so I'm just gonna skip to the biggest piece of f****ed up s***t in the series, Yukiteru. From here on out there's gonna be a lot of spoilers so if you haven't seen the series just jump to the last paragraph D:


First, he starts of as a whimp. Then, he gets the diary... and remains a whimp. Sure, all okay for now. Then he falls for Yuno despite for her being a stalker...then discovers that she has dead people in a room of her house, that she logically didn't think of hiding or anything. Why even, when it's perfectly hidden in a huge fucking room O_O

So, he discovers that yet doesn't tell a cop who he knows and just so happens to also be a diary owner... why? No reason. Instead he decides to act like he saw nothing and STILL HANGS OUT WITH YUNO! Sure he acts scared, but that doesn't change the fact he keep staying in the vicinity of a stalking, psycopathic killer... next we have how a new friend of Yukiteru's later reveals herself to be the daughter of a diary owner and tries to kill him... and her innocent friend who seemed adorable also tries to kill people because why not. Then Yuki does some random motivational speech and they are all friends again... even though one of them almost died after being stabbed by another one of them...  NEXT UP! Yukiteru's divorcee father turns out to be a royal asshole who leaves Yuki in a falling building to die while he escapes with the last parachute... and then kills Yuki's mother accidentaly on purpose... and Yuki then decidedly forgives him and wants to see fireworks with him...AND I'M JUST GETTING STARTED GUYS! I also have to add a ton of scenes in a ton of episodes in which Yuki discovers from freaky shit from Yuno, freaks out and stays away from her for an ep or two, and then gets back together with her. Constantly. Like, every 5 episodes. At least. Also, remember how Yuki is supposedly psychologically growing due to all the stress and hardships? Yeah, there actually gets to a point where he apparently doesn't care anymore and starts to kill everyone just to win... two episodes later, mental breakdown, and he drops right back to how he had begun the series. As a worthless whimp. Great psychological evolution, great indeed.

Now as for other flaws I want to point out. Apart from the diaries and Deus, we can more or less see that the world is supposedly our world... so then how is it explained that Hirasaka can create clones of himself and hypnotise people? How come the mayor not only talks to Deus, which we can push aside as the same with Yuki, but also somehow was able to, by himself, create the diares? How does a baby manage to get himself a ton of lethal armament and a gas mask? And forward mail? BEING A BABY? How come Yuno's father, apparently normal, knows that his wife is sick enough to stick his daughter inside of a cage without food for an entire day and doesn't do absolutely anything?

...as for a final scene, mayor spoiler here of course, I want to add that the ending, despite looking like a "happy ending", with every character o so happy and such... we have to remember that that's just a different dimension. Those are other people. In our present Yuki's real dimension, he killed his friends. They are dead. Forever. They ain't coming back and they know who killed him. That "happy ending" is practically just an illusion. It's like watching a war film where everyone dies but then showing a happy family on the other side of the planet with no care in the world. Sure, they are happy, but our main characters arent'. Not one bit.




Final paragraph here. So, in general, character development, character psychology... saying this series has it is an insult to psychology... this series is as realistic as Fairy Tail, although luckily this series isn't as bad as that one.

It looks like I've ripped this series apart, and I won't say I haven't but its still got good things. The story, as I said, is really original and has some unexpected twists, the art is for the most part excelent and its quite enjoyable. The opening and ending songs are also a pleasant treat to listen to. So, good things are plot, art, music and general entertainment, but sadly it's not enough to cover the horrendous and blatantly terrible characters within.

I started watching Mirai Nikki when episode 23 aired. I finished downloading them all at around midnight, and I stayed up until I had watched them all.
 -The story is amazing (10). When I started watching, I thought it would a predictable story that wouldn't entertain me at all, but it was quite the opposite. I don't want to spoil anything, though, so I'll just leave it at that.
 -Art? Loved it (9). The animation is very good, and it stays with the sort of creepy feel of the anime, while at the same time looking normal when it needs to be. The characters havepupils. I don't know what it is about them, but it adds to the creepiness during the creepy parts.\n
 -Sound. (9). I've enjoyed both of the OPs, especially the first. They both suit the anime very well, and they, unlike some other anime like this, don't show spoilers about the story. In the show itself, the voices and sound effects are great. They avoid having any music at some of the suspenseful parts, and this only adds to the suspense. I personally don't like it when suspenseful music plays at these parts because it just tells me something will happen. The voices are all good, too, especially considering how the seiyuus of both main characters are inexperienced. \n
 -Character (9). Most of the characters develop over the course of the show, especially Yuno. I can't really say much else without super-spoilers, but the  only reason this isn't a 10 is because so far, Yukiteru hasn't developed as much as I think he should have. Not to say he hasn't changed, though, because he has. It would be a 9.5 if I were allowed to give it that.\n
 -Enjoyment (10). It kept me up for about 8 hours or so, from midnight to about 8am. I think that's enough to say how much I enjoyed it. \n
 -Overall (10). Sure, there are more 9/10 ratings than 10/10, but considering how good everything was, 10 seems fair. I think I will forever be a fan of this show, and regardless of your type of anime, you should watch it too. I'm usually a fan of slice of life/comedy type anime, and, hold off the "lol of course, anything is better than slice of life" jokes, I enjoyed this to no end. \n
Get off your ass, stand up, sit back down again, navigate to a site where you can watch this in 1080p, and spend the next 8 hours of your life watching it. That is an order, and you will enjoy it.\n

This is my first time writing a review so if I wrote anything that you don't agree on or you just hated my writing skills my apologies. Basically, this anime is about survival horror, psychological, romance, supernatural, suspense. If you like watching characters going CRAZY I recommend you to watch this anime.  It starts of a middle schooler Yukiteru, an anti social bystander who writes everything he see in his phone "diary". In his room he talks to his "imaginary" friend Deus Ex Machina, the God of Time and Space. Deus told Yukiteru to participate in a "Royal Battle" with other eleven people. Thiseleven "diary holders" would have to kill each other and the last one standing gets to replace Deus. The diary has it unique ways to predict the future and trapped each other "diary holders" to a "dead end".

Story=9

The story is amazing and it keeps me watching and waiting for a new episode each week. As you watch the anime along, you'll start to ask questions and it would just drive you insane. It's fantastic how almost all diary holders had a rough past and would do anything for love, power, and vengeance. 

Art=8

The characters is really drawn appealing and their facial reaction is perfect in every scene. But the violence, bloody, gory scenes is not scary or disgusting enough to make puke and not sleep at night. Well which is a good thing because I don't want that to happen to me especially at Sunday night since I have school and all that. :D The art is typically the one you see at most mecha anime but they made the color more lighter.

Sound=9

The first opening really fits the anime and probably the most "original" one I've ever listened to. At first I always skipped the opening because it gives me the chills but I got used to it and I totally loved it. 

Character=8

I would give it a 9 but Yukiteru ruined it. He is the most annoying cry baby character you'll ever meet in the anime. He is one of those "normal" characters you'll meet in the anime while the rest are just INSANE which made them cool :D But of course they exaggerated a bit on the characters which made it  either annoying,weird,unrealistic (I know this anime is fiction but come on make the character traits more realistic or human).

Enjoyment=10

After watching only the first episode I can't stop watching it. I even read the manga to know what will happen next. Most of the time you'd probably be all serious, cry (a bit), or just scared.

Overall=9

Maybe 9.25 or 9.5. Great anime and I would recommend you to watch it. Not the kind of anime you'll see often. As you watch it, you better like NINE!!!! :) I swear she is the most interesting and attractive girl you'll ever meet in the anime. Have fun watching the anime :)
