This review is spoiler-free
Mirai Nikki started off great, i started watching when it was about 13 episodes in. 
As the episodes moved on I noticed a dramatic drop in quality. The characters slowly became terrible, save for Yuno. The characters were not believable at all. Yukki feels like a bad Shinji ripoff, but instead of having depth and character like Shinji, he really is just a little bitch. His abnormal tendency to forgive people who were trying to kill him 5 minutes prior is painful. Instead of giving the impression that he's desperate for affection, it just makes him impossible to like. His sudden personalitychange to a terribly cliche, over confident "shounen jump badass" made me cringe, and even Yuno was awful in these stages. The direction of the anime seemed childish, like they were trying to be cool by adding action and plot twists. The art wasn't too bad, though it wasn't the best either. The OPs are fairly representative of the quality of the show. The first complemented the series and was actually very good. The second half's OP had such bad engrish i was embarrassed to watch it. Each week after about episode 16 left me disappointed, expecting the great stuff I saw in the earlier episodes that i loved.\n
After watching the whole series i felt like a had been taken advantage of. I realise that lots of people will disagree with this review, claiming Mirai Nikki is "badass", but to be fair, lots of people like Naruto. I really am not trying to offend people, other than Naruto fans, but it had to be said.\n
overall, i would say, if you're looking for anime that feels like shounen jump while being more violent, with sexy Yuno, this might be for you. overall i wouldn't reccomend it

Mirai Nikki was a very enjoyable anime, but the being said, I thought it was no where near perfect even though it was good. I only gave this one an eight because I thought that the whole time travel thing was used way too late in the anime to be used effectively also, I did not like the fact that there was no way to like Yuno Gasai as much  as I thought I could have until you find out why she is like that.  I like the comedy relief character in the anime almost as much as my first, second, and thirdfavorites.  The comic relief was none other than twelfth because of the whole power rangers ripoff thing he had going on, outstanding.  In order my three favorites diary user were Yukiteru, Yuno, then both Marco and Ai (seventh) all three of these characters were amazing for their own details.  This anime was a very well written story but it of course had it's flaws that could have been prevented without the whole time travel thing.

This review doesn't contain any spoilers.
Mirai Nikki (further referred as MN) is a phenomenon in it's own way. I mean, how often do you see an anime, which is better than the manga it adapts? I don't think it would be easy to name at least 3 such titles. Even though "better" is extremely subjective in it's own way. I mean, most of the people who watched this probably don't even know it's an adaptation. But this isn't the only reason, you see. I will dive deeper now.
The story starts rather simple. There is this Yukiteru Amane boy, who enjoys staying isolated from his classmates.Describing himself as "the spectator", Yuki writes everything he sees around himself in a diary in his mobile phone. Also, Yuki often talks to his imaginary friend called Deus Ex Machina, or simply Deus sometimes, who also is a god. A slip of a tongue, when Yuki tells him he is bored living that way, leads to see by yourself.


Twenty six episodes of MN took me 2 days to complete, even though I had to attend my university in parallel, so you can say each second of my free time was spent on them. And that is my fastest TV series so far. MN is not fast paced or rushed, but it is just so action filled I could not have stopped after I began. Time? Studies? Pfft, another crazy scene, coming right in!


Although I think I began from a wrong end here. The main reason for this anime to become so popular and the thing people who watched this think of first when hearing about it is it's chardesign. Well, not character design in common, but a single character - a pink-haired yandere named Gasai Yuno. By the way, if you don't know what's yandere, you can google it up. Or you can just watch the anime, it's quite obvious by itself. Anyway, Yuno appears almost instantly after the series start and instantly starts kicking in with her bad-assery. She is just so so bad-ass she looks more of a main character than Yuki does. Probably the most widely-known yandere character ever, I bet you already saw Yuno somewhere. Tons of fan art of her everywhere. Just how cool every second of her is, I think, compensates for a completely stupid main character.


One another thing is how everything fits just in. The sound, the drawings, the story. The best opening I saw so far, also. It's just that action packed. One of my fellows referred to this as to "one large freak circus", and this somehow fits great. I mean, there are scenes those similar to those "strategic" ones like in Death Note, almost shounen type fights and chases (in the positive meaning of this, of course), touching drama scenes (wow). Even "just talks" and those often boring parts when they try to, ugh... "revelate", "expand" characters looks extremely interesting and fun. And, of course, these SUDDEN STORY TWISTS that you are not prepared for.


Ah, by the way, DO NOT read anything about this on the internets. The major spoiler can ruin the whole story, you see. And the story is the main plus of the series.


Concluding the review, MN is not much of an anime, as a virus or a disease of some sort. It infects you and your head, leaving you to think of this one large action scene again and again. And to think of Yuno too. I haven't yes talked to anyone who disliked this, and I talked kind of to a lot of people about anime. Anyways, Mirai Nikki, instant classic and a must watch for everyone.

Mirai Nikki, in all honesty, was a pretty bad show. The beginning of the show wasn't that bad. As the show continued on, it tried mixing in a lot of things which eventually made the story a complete mess. It felt like they were adding in random shit as it went along and was really nothing but senseless fighting.
Yukiteru was a really bad character and got on my nerves a lot. I understand how being in a situation like that would leave someone frightened, but he pretty much let Yuno do his dirty work for the entirety of the show. He was also really stupid.
(spoiler)
Whenhis dad murdered his mom and left him on a building to die, he forgave him for all of it for some stupid cliche childhood promise of looking through a fucking telescope to stare at some stars.

(/spoiler)


Art:

The art was average. It wasn't bad, and it wasn't good at the same time. The animation of Deus was quite different from everyone else though.


Sound:

I really liked the first theme song. It was a lot better than the second one. The voices kind of matched the characters (especially Yuki for being a huge faggot).


Character:

There really wasn't much character development. This is mainly because everyone gets killed of too quickly. Minene and Keigo are the only exceptions to this.


Enjoyment:

This show was somewhat enjoyable. I liked Minene. Everything else was honestly for the shits and giggles.


Overall: 3


This review is kind of all over the place because I watched this show a long time ago but just now decided to write a review about it.

Story-wise I found the anime rather intriguing as it is full of twists in the places where you least expect them. The story has a very good pace and it does not slow down at all, which is great because it keeps the audience entertained throughout the 26 episodes.
I especially love this anime partly because I was mesmerized by how the anime is brave and straight forward with the gore without having the audience turning away from the screen. If I compare this anime with Another, I will say that this anime's gory elements is way more entertaining than the ones in Another as inthis anime you are actually thinking along with the characters: "Die b*tch dieee-!" rather than "Oh sh*t another person just die, UMMM....= ="


I also fell in love with the character developments in Mirai Nikki. Other than the yandere craziness, Gasai Yuno brings the audience to understand that sometimes love can become an illness, and that a person can become evil through motivations that originally evolve from a pure and innocent wish. It's her insecurity of not being able to receive love from her childhood that contributes to her insanity and her obsession with Yukiteru. Like Yagami Light in Death Notes whose arrogance and hunger for power lead him astray from his original goal of creating justice for the world, Gasai Yuno in Mirai Nikki turns her desire for love into something monstrous and uncontrollable... and I will just leave it at that since I don't want to spoil the story for anyone. And if you can follow my odd comparison of Gasai Yuno to Yagami Light still, the most impressive part about this story is that unlike Light who meets destruction in the end, Yuno is actually saved by love, hope, and forgiveness.... Okay. I will shut up now.


So yeah, definitely watch this mind-blowing anime! I highly recommend it. & Akise Aru, dayum, gotta love that boy.

THIS REVIEW CONTAINS SPOILERS
What do you think of when you hear the words "wasted potential"?
The most popular answer seems to be Sword Art Online: the story of how a decent action anime descended into the flames of Harem Hell. This is certainly true, but let's save that rant for another day.
Today we talk about Mirai Nikki (The Future Diary)
This is rant about of brutal betrayal and wasted imagination.
This is a review of plot holes galore, cheaply written characters, and a shonen/seinen identity crises.
This is the story of M&M's personal vendetta against Mirai Nikki.
*puts on +2 helmet of smithing*
Bring on the hate, my friends. I'm ready.
DISCLAIMER:This rant is not liable for damages to home, property, 18th century pottery, or goldfish due to subsequent fan rampages.


Consult your psychologist before reading.


CONTAINS: PEANUTS, GLUTEN, AND SPOILERS



Story: 3/10


"Let's throw in all the cool things and see what sticks!"


This was evidently the attitude of the whoever wrote this train wreck of a plot. Sure it's cool. Sure the fight scenes are awesome. But is it good?


No.


There was definitely good premise here. I liked the survival game setup and the concept of the future diaries. Unfortunately, the show fails to execute its ideas.


Mirai Nikki is a classic story of "style over substance". It cares far more about how "cool" everything is than how the plot actually works.


Due to this, the series is chock-full of plot holes and completely illogical scenarios.


Here are some examples:


• A small child has perfect access to poison gas with no explanation


• Yuno has bodies locked up in a room in her house just rotting on the floor, and the authorities never find them


• Sloppy murders are committed in broad daylight with little to no police involvement


I can deal with a few out-of-the-box plot events, but virtually every part of the plot is highly improbable. None of these events are impossible, but they are unlikely. (I realize that this is a fantasy series, but even fantasies should follow basic storytelling rules). There should never be random, illogical things that appear without an explanation (e.g. there are killer robot dogs that someone just "made").


A lot of the worst story problems seem to stem from random, illogical decisions on the part of the characters, just for the sake of convenience. For example, people are complete unfazed when a terrorist bombs the school. If I remember correctly, Yukki's mom never even bothered check up on him about it. I mean, it would have to have been on the news at some point. It seems highly improbable that she wouldn't know or care.


Aside from plot holes, there was another element of the storytelling that bothered me: Mirai Nikki has a seinen/shonen identity crises.


The anime wanted so desperately to be mature and psychological, but it also tried to appeal to younger audiences with wildly misplaced humor. It is super hard to have both of those things, and Mirai Nikki failed to pull it off. It didn't have the strength to pull off the themes it wanted to.



Characters: 2/10


The characters are extremely stereotypical and I was deeply disappointed with them.


The main character, Yukki, wasn't terrible, but he was misused. He mostly just served to whine about how crazy everything was. Yukki also does a random 180 in his attitude towards the end which did little to help my perception of him.


Yuno, probably one of the most overrated characters in history, was simply there to be a yandere. She fits the stereotype perfectly.


Character development was forced and, again, mostly for convenience. For example, Nine, the bad ass terrorist, is quickly reduced to the role of tsundere for the sake of simplicity.


The supporting cast was, for the most part, terribly exaggerated. The villains were way too reminiscent of typical shonen villains: gimmicky and over-the-top. In one episode, there was a man who dressed up as a giant eyeball and hypnotized people into fighting for him, Power Rangers' style.


Why.



Art/Sound: 7/10


This is what Mirai Nikki excels at. The op was awesome, and it's still one of my favorite ops today. The action was slick and stylized.


Though it's far from being the goriest anime out there, it could still be a fun watch for gore fans.



Enjoyment: 3/10


Mirai Nikki is far from a masterpiece, but there are worse things out there. For this reason, Mirai Nikki receives a score of 3 (almost completely terrible, but with some redeeming qualities).


To me, Mirai Nikki can be a fun watch if you don't think too much about it. Since I'm a nitpicker, and I HATE poor writing, my enjoyment suffered.


Overall, if you can sit back, relax, and accept it for what it is, you'll love Mirai Nikki.


But if you're like me and it's physically impossible to stop analyzing, you'll probably curse this heap of wasted potential forever.

[NOTE: There are minor spoilers in this review]
What happens when you take "The Hunger Games" and include iPhones?
You get Mirai Nikki.
Mirai Nikki was one of those anime that really had uniqueness. Each character..ehm, I mean diary, was each different and each had a specific trait that matched what each of the diary owners characteristic were. Anyways, Mirai Nikki had so much twists and shock to the point where I was speechless(especially in Episode 23...that shocked me the most.)
Mirai Nikki was a really entertaining anime because it felt like I watched "The Hunger Games" in Anime version or in Japanese for instance. The concept was interestingand the characters actually had good character development with the main protagonists.


Story: The basic concept was basically a survival game to see who would be the next God of Time and Space, set up by the current God of the world. The God chose 12? (hopefully i'm accurate -_-) people to battle it out with their phon...I mean...diaries so they can plan out how to eliminate them. I liked the concept because it would create a lot of twists and suspencefullness, this felt like one of those anime which will hold you on the back of your seats! (9/10)


Art: The artwork was pretty good and solid, I really like the gore they added though because it made it look a little realistic. The animation is a little bit funky looking, but I didn't change my mind that it was still enjoyable. (8.5/10)


Sound: The sound...it was alright at first, but then it started getting a little down and down, but the sound-track was amazing! I couldn't stop listening to the 2nd Arc Ending! Anyways, the sound was pretty good, could've improved a little more though.


Character: Each character had uniqueness...that's it. But overall, the protagonists and antagonists were each fun and clever. Each of the antagonists had interesting plans to kill each other with their diaries and they all have intelligent in them, that's what I like. From the protagonists however, Yuki was a little lob-sided, but still was a fun character to watch. Yuno however, was just the example of a perfect Yandere! She blew my mind from being a nice, gentle girl to this...idk what to call her...DEVIL! She became a deviled demon...and she was just badass in my opinion. They could've improved the character tbh, but still overall good. (7.5/10)


Enjoyment: I ENJOYED THIS SERIES SO MUCH! I loved this battle that they had! Made me feel like "what's gonna happen next?" "who's gonna die?" "what will happen?" it made me ask these questions that later on would give me a lot of interesting answers. Just an enjoyable anime overall and you would love it too! (9.5/10)


Should you watch this anime: Yes, definite watch, especially if you love Horror, Drama, and Suspence. This is a perfect watch for people because Mirai Nikki was a pretty good series overall and you might enjoy it also!


Similar Anime: Higurashi, Death Note, Sword Art Online(in the aspect of "surviving")


Final Comments: The anime really hit me, and I was glad that my friends told me to watch it because it was just amazing and I look forward to reading the manga in the future!


Rating: 8.5/10


(Thank you guys for reading my first ever review...i'm not really good at writing reviews, but I gave it a try! Let me know what you think in my profile and I hope you enjoyed this review and you hope for me to post the next one!)

This is one seriously hard anime to review because I feel like I watched 3 different anime. The show has some very serious tone and theme problems, and at no point in time did it feel like this show came into it's own. 
The premise behind this show is a survival game w/ 12 players, all of whom armed with magical fortune telling devices. I'm an absolute sucker for this genre. And this one sounds like it's really set up well. Thoughtful, bloody, and mature... I picked it up hoping for some serious cat and mouse mind games.
Unfortunately, it's a lazy show. I was hopingfor some really cool deductions with the main character trying to find out who owns the Future Diaries, but 99% of the time, the owners just announce themselves to the protagonists. They rarely even go into detail about how these Diary Holders even found the protagonist. Very disappointing. The ending tries to get clever, and it could have been, but that laziness creeps in and they cheat by changing a few key characters and their motivations. Hard to go into detail without spoiling. 


Well how about the conflicts? The mind games they set up (some, rather elaborately), are usually trumped with simple violence almost always coming from the always crazy terrifying character Yuno, who possesses the impossible gift of always being able to see through other ppl's schemes. Seriously, it's not that she has an uncanny gift for foiling their enemies plans... she has an IMPOSSIBLE gift. One only attainable through lazy writing. 


The tones shift wildly from super serious cat-and-mouse, to super violent blood fest, to high school romance, to childish cutesy shonen comedy nonsense. There's one scene where a one eyed villian, who in a previous episode bombed a junior high school, get into a super cutesy fight with a super cutesy little girl (who's a god) after she messes up her hair style. At any given time, I have no idea when things are going to take a turn down WTF road. Also, on a side note, I could have definetly dealt with less fan service. Not that this one was aggregious (I'm looking at you No Game No Life). I just love anime, and everytime we have to sit through a high school girl in her panties, we go back 3 steps in the fight of making anime mainstream. It alienates people!


As for themes? Nothing overarching as I can see it. Maybe something to do with the timidity of the main character holding him back from living a nice life?  


The ensemble characters are great and varied, and there were definitely a few surprises in them, but unfortunately, the main story is bogged down with an insufferable, whiny mess of a main character. Yukkii does nothing but whine at his allies, they usually fix his mess, and that wouldn't be so bad if he was a side character, but as the protagonist, we're forced to observe this world through his eyes, and his paralyzed inaction makes for some really uncompelling scenes. You get frustrated with him really really quickly. 


BUT! After all that negativity I'm still giving this a positive review. Mostly because I just really really love this genre and I'm a sucker. Good characters, cool universe, buttloads of potential... lots of problems though...

When I started watching anime i needed suggestions to get started and the first thing people said to me was Mirai Nikki/Future diary, not knowing what i was getting into I pressed ahead and started watching.
The story of Mirai Nikki or future diary is a what if story? what if we could change the future? what if our lives were a game and what if our phones were things that kept us alive.
Mirai Nikki forces the viewer to watch as characters compete in a survival game, the story can be a little hard to follow and you can lose track of what has happened buteach and every episode leaves you wanting more and more while leaving you in suspense about what could happen to the main characters. but due to how intense the story can get and how easily you can lose your way I've given it a six.


The Art of this show is a high standard and helps brings out a characters personality for example when certain scenes portray the character in a different light i.e obsessive. 


The art helps make you want to back away but all the while gripping you to ensure you will continue watching. for I've given it a ten


The sound was not as powerful as the art but was still very good and kept you gripped until the very end of the episode, both the opening and ending themes suited the show and i have little complaints on this part. so this i have given it an eight.


Characters, oh my those characters are unforgettable especially Yuno she has her cute side and then her yandere side, each character suits there role but at times in the story character development either didn't happen or happened to quickly. still the characters make up for the fairly written story and for that reason i've given it a nine.


The enjoyment overall was fantastic and i never once found myself wanting to drop this show as its too good to pass up and lets be honest this show just keep making you want to watch more and more and that's why i love it. 


That combined with the characters and the art and you have a near perfect show but if you don't keep track you easily lose your way as they don't really do recaps but over all a fantastic show that i highly recommend you watch and hare and it remains one of the most known if not one of the greatest anime that i have watched.

By far my favorite anime of all times.
Characters-10
 The characters are amazing and very deep, even the side characters. Though Yuki is quite the wimp and not the cool, amazing character like ichigo, naruto, etc., his loyalty and morals are good enough. Yuno's badass personality also makes up for Yuki's. 
Plot-10
The plot is pretty creative and so is the whole story line idea. 12 dairies which can predict the future, the last survivor becomming god... what can be better. There's love, friendship, betrayal and everything a good anime has.
Every character has their own plot and has their story intertwined into the series.
Art/Sound-10
The Art and Soundis creative/original. Every Character's voice is perfectly matched especially Yuno with her normal and stalker crazy voice. =)\n\n
Enjoyment-11\n
can't even begin. Once i started, i got soo hooked that i rewatched the 3rd and 4th episode 4 times... The storyline is very unpredictable yet amazing.Though, i did finish the manga and it makes you love the series even more because Yuno happens to be not as crazy as you think. Every question (there are many) that you have are all answered in the end, so just be patient. The plot was well thought out.

Mirai Nikki is one of my favourite animes, it is a gore /romance /drama /action anime .. yeah a lot of stuff.. does it excels at everything? I will explain every point. 
Story: 9/10. It may seem "wtf is this" at the beginning, because it's really confusing, but i believe that the story has no plot holes and everything gets the right explanation sooner or later. Don´t worry if it seems boring during the first episodes, because it is a litle boring because it's confuse. Once you get the plot, around the 5th episode, this anime just gets better and better until the end. 
Thestory is a little bit complex and it may seem stupid .. well if you are of those who criticise everything and just likes slice of life (animes close to reality) well then yes it is stupid. If you are like me, a open mind, you will say "this is actually cool".. the plot for me was really creative and original.


Character:9/10. Probably you already heard about Gasai Yuno .. no? Well look in the web for this name and see the pictures xD .. she is just one of the most known characters of all time.. why ? Because she is not a clichê .. she is totally different from everything that i saw until now .. really a magnificent character .. 



She has everything that a character needs in a gore anime .. i loved the contrast between the good Yuno and the evil one and i think it matches just perfectly with her design (her design can be for a good person or a bad one, she is both good and bad so that's why the design is great) 


Besides that, as i said, she is not a clichê. Her feelings, her actions/reactions are unpredictable, and i just love that! Being incapable of guessing what's gonna happening it's just a nice thing ! She also have a brilliant development, really deep, really detailed, but it is not boring. Usually in a action anime, development is boring .. here .. it is better than the action it self.  


Also the "evolution" of the other main character, Yukiteru is great. 


Throughout the anime, we can see his evolution, he starts being a pussy and then .. well i can´t tell you because i would be spoiling but there is an interesting evolution along with the plot development on Yukiteru. There is just one little problem .. during 90% of the show, Yukiteru is a pain in the ass, really anoying.. 


Sound: 8/10. Some OST are nice, reasonable. Others are "meh" and then we have some nice OST. But i want to talk about the 1st opening. It is just mind blowing. One of the best until now. It just looks so nice when we compare it to the anime .. just fits so well and the music it self is cool. I really loved the opening, and i belive it is well done and matches perfectly with the anime. 


Art: 7/10. The character design is not the best out there. Also the background is not good either, but they are not on the bottom of the line, i found them reasonable, neither good nor bad. In the middle so. 


Enjoyment: Well here our opinions can be extremely different. For those who like drama / horror (which are my favorite types) will find this anime outrageous. Plus we have a nice action and a nice romance. In fact, the romance here is one of the best romances i've ever saw. It just looks so different from the rest, which makes it pretty damn good. But if you like drama/romance without the horror scenes(so a normal slice life) you may not find this anime so good. Personally this anime is pretty original, creative and has great points to look at. So only if you hate horror you will dislike this anime. Moreover, this show has the best plot twist and the best ending that i've ever saw ! I will never forget this end for real !!! It has everything to be a nice ending. It is emotional, it is deep, it is so original, it just looks awesome, really it worth so much watching this show just because of this end. If you like sad endings, this one of them .. but and if you like happy endings? Well guess what this ending is both sad and happy .. just there are no words to describe this ending.


Overall: 9/10. I recomend it, it's a great show although it has a slow start, but at the end with that great final you will love both the begining and the ending. I found on this show, the perfect balance between romance/drama and gore, it also have some funny moments and the action is good. So i don´t know what is missing in this anime ;P

So let me tell you about how good this show is, I literally loved every minute of Mirai Nikki. After I finished it I made everyone I know(who was willing) watch it and then I watched it again just because I could. The best thing about the anime is that it keeps you guessing and basically in suspense up until the very end and at the end after all of the suspense you cry, you cry for years. The mc is extremely annoying but that's because he isn't like usually mc's where they are heroic and ready to battle whatever comes their way, he's morerealistic and how an actual 15 year old would react to the situation he is thrown in. Mirai Nikki is incredibly violent and gruesome at times so I wouldn't recommend it for those who are squeamish. Advice for future viewers; Please for all the is good in this world watch the OVA when you finish the show, it seriously makes the ending to the anime 10x better and not as depressing.

*Warning: This review may contain spoilers and is actually a rant*
Mirai Nikki is yet another anime with extremely interesting premise that completely wasted its Potential. It's about 12 people who have to fight against each other until only one is left with help of diaries (usually phones).
I'll start with the easiest things to write. The Animation in this anime seems really weird to me, the character designs are incredibly weird, bold and sometimes the character movement looks ridiculous. The colour palette is full of too bright and shiny colours which ruin the atmosphere (why couldn't they use darker colours?). Both opening and Ending themes byYuusei Teikoku and Faylan are simply very catchy and great songs and I find myself listening to them sometimes even now. The background music and voices are however average at best. (With exception of 5th's voice, which makes me want to punch kittens.)


Now the characters:

-1st, Yukiteru Amano is one of the most hated anime characters in recent anime history and is basically product of recent anime trend of pussy protagonists usually protected by insane girls (e.g. Ganta Igarashi, Shuu Ouma and that Accel World fatass, but the first real one is Shinji Ikari). At first I didn't know why every body hated him (C'mon, he's 14 year old, you would be scareed too!), but the thing is that even though some characters like Jacuzzi Splot are crybabies, they become stronger over time or grow balls when it's needed, but Yukiteru never does! He's always the same stupid pussy who never learns from his mistakes and tries too hard to save everyone and ends up killing lots of people. But that's not the worst thing! What absolutely pissed me off was when his father betrayed him several times and killed his mother and father told him it was for his good and wanted to see the stars with him and Yuki forgave him like nothing happened! WHAT THE ACTUAL F_!:$ô,cK?!?!

-2nd, Yuno Gasai is probably the reason why you're watching this show, she's a psycho girl obsessed with Yuki and a part of the trend of yandere characters, I honestly don't like her because she's absolutely braindead and doesn't think about anything other than Yuukii and killing everybody (and everything) that comes close to him. Lame.

-3rd, Takao Hiyama is absolutely stupid and irrelevant character who dies in the first episode and has incredibly ridiculous outfit.

-4th, Keigo Kurusu is the most important side character of the 1st half of the show, he's a detective with ridiculous hair and incredibly indecisive.

-5th, Reisuke Houjou is one of the most annoying characters I've seen in a while, he's a 5-year old boy who's extremely selfish and he's got access to lethal weapons which even most adults don't.

-6th, Tsubaki Kasugano is just a whiny insane bitch. (Even though it's not really her own fault.)

-7th, Ai Mikami and Marco Ikusaba are a boring girl who throws knives and a douchebag with the stupid haircut.

-8th, Kamado Ueshita is a character with arguably the 2nd most powerful diary and the ugliest character design I've seen in some time. Even though she's powerful, she is irrelevant to story herself and dies absolutely stupid way.

-9th, Minene Uruyuu is the only diary holder that I kind of like for her craziness and liking to blow up stuff, but that doesn't mean much.

-10th, Karyuudo Tsukishima is a crazy man obsessed with dogs (probably some PETA activist?) who dies almost immediately after he is introduced.

-11th, John Balks, the most important character of the 2nd half (is it just me or does he look like a Jew?) who is obsessed with power. Meh.

-12th, Yomotsu Hirasaka is a totally braindead character who is blind and pretends to be a superhero who dies absolutely stupid death even though he knows he would.

Other Characters:

-Deus Ex Machina and Murmur, almighty God of time and space with terrible hairstyle (how come he doesn't know the winner of the game, he could have spared the lives of all the stupid people who senselessly died) and the most annoying loli I've ever seen with some retarded comedy specials.

-Aru Akise,  The only character I really liked, even though he is a Near ripoff and Yaoi fangirls fanservice character, but he's at least kind of smart unlike everybody else.

-Ouji Kousaka, retarded douchebag.

-Hinata Hino, another useless girl.

-Mao Nonosaka. If Akise was fanservioce for yaoi fangirls, this girl was just a stupid fanservice for yuri fanboys

-Kurou Amano, Throw. him. into. FIRE. I so wanted to see this guy die violently.

-Rea Amano, Yuki's mother who obviously doesn't give a damn what her son is doing so she just designs some (eroge?) games. (probably PS3 exclusives)

-Masumi Nishijima, another police officer who's in love with Minene, also useless. (why the hell am i writing about him?)


The story basically consists of lots of interesting but incredibly lame and extremely anticlimactic twists. (Take the death of the 11th for example.) But there is just something that keeps you watching it even though it makes mostly no sense.

The thing that makes absolutely no sense is that since 1st killed 3rd everyone is just going after him, which seems really stupid. more "free for all" approach would have been welcome. There is also some stupid forced romance.

And the conclusion totally reminds me of Madoka Magica because it uses that Deus Ex Machina Time-leaping bullcrap again. As much as I disliked both Eden of the East endings, they were still better than this crap.


To sum it up, Mirai Nikki is dumb fun, it is bad, but if you turn of your brain, you might enjoy this.

*Excuse some typographic mistakes*


Overall: a strong 6.4

I never wrote a review for any Anime before but this is definitely worth it!

Mirai Nikki. A pretty popular anime where the female mc may be more popular than the show itself. It's a love hate anime where you either love it or want to burn it. I so wanted to burn it. Are there spoilers in this review? Maybe.
Story- 4
The idea of a survival game wasn't really original but it's not really overused. But the idea of having diaries that can tell the future was a bit intriguing. The way the story was executed was fucking poor though. The first mc introduced is Yukiteru Amano (aka Yuki) who is a 2nd year in middle school that has nofriends, but spends his time recording his surroundings in his phone. In his imagination, he talks to Deus Ex Machina, the god of time and space,  and their servant Mur Mur. One day, he finds out that the entries in his phone have already been written. It was the beginning of the day and the entries were about things that were to happen a few minutes or hours later. He uses this as a way to get around school and avoid trouble. That was his future diary. And then, the second mc is introduced. It's Gasai Yuno. You know, the poster girl of Mirai Nikki that apparently everyone loves who has crazy eyes and pink hair with ribbons. She is obsessed with Yukiteru (or as he likes to call him 'Yuki!!') and the viewers find out that she herself has a future diary that's all about what Yukiteru will do every ten minutes--it doesnt matter if she's with/near him or not, she will get entries about him no matter what. She confesses her love for him and after protecting him from a serial murderer who's been targeting Yukiteru, they meet Deus Ex Machina and learn that they are in a survival game with 10 other people where they all have to kill each other in order to gain position as the new god of space and time. Sounds interesting, but as the anime goes on, the whole thing becomes a mess.


Art-6

There's nothing special about the art, but it was pretty consistent. It wasn't like Kyoto where there were sparkling eyes and cherry blossoms everywhere. Nor was it SHAFT with head tilts every five seconds. It was mediocre, but I do appreciate that the quality didnt go up and down from good to shitty.


Sound-9

This is the only good thing about the anime. The OPs and EDs are very good and catchy. It really went along with the whole horror, [psychological, thriller theme.


Characters-1

The characters were so pathetic. This was the worst part of the whole anime.


Yukiteru Amano- He is the biggest fuckboy in anime HISTORY probably. That might be going a bit far, but that's how i see. For about 95% of the anime, he is cowering behind Yuno as she does all the dirty work for him. I mean, I know he was a middle schooler who was just placed into a survival game, but can he not cry out every 5 seconds it gave me headaches. He's screaming and crying most of the time, and is gullible as hell. First, you make him weak, and you gotta add gullible too? Too much. The good thing that he was no generic anime hero like Kirito from SAO or Tatsuya from Mahouka, but that's also the bad thing about him. It's as if the writers didn't know about something called a 'realistic character'. It's either they're a fuckboy or a 'flawless' and dull hero. And by realistic character, I mean make them have internal conflicts that they actually SOLVE, and also have them become strong internally and physically without bullshit. His character had no development and even when there was 'development', he acted like a cool 'badass' for 3 episodes and then went back to crying. It was so laughable....welp they tried. But what's even worse is the fact that he's so forgiving. Being a forgiving person is an incredible trait; it helps you grow as a person. But Yukiteru was so forgiving I couldn't believe it. His ability to forgive was only annoying and of course did no good for his character. You could kill his whole family and then say you love him and stab someone for him and then he'd go from hiding in the corner to worshiping you again...that was unbelievable too. His feelings were really confusing too; by the end of the anime, I was questioning all his feelings and choices because I couldn't believe how stupid and weird he was. But they probably made his character this way so that there'd be a purpose to bring in Yuno.


Yuno Gasai-  Psychically cute I guess. Total badass who can kill without regret or moment of doubt. That's all she is. A 'yandere'. People said that they only enjoyed the show because of her which was not the case for me. Watching her killing people was only enjoyable if I didn't really like the character, but everything else about Yuno was terrible. She was a 14 year old who dedicated her life to another 14 year old who couldn't even decide what to eat on his own. She was selfish and annoying; she couldn't even let Yuki do what he wanted to do, like have any other friend who wasn't her. She only thought about her own feelings which showed that she wasn't really in love with him--idk what she was but that is not love. I mean, drugging your crush and trying to seduce him in just your undergarments while you make his close classmates watch him be taken advantage of? Totally selfish and unnecessary. What she did to Yuki was not cute at all and everytime she showed up and screamed 'Yuki!!' I cringed and wanted to die. Which was every fucking second. She made me incredibly uncomfortable and I don't care what she did to herself at the end of the series. I still believe that she never loved Yuki and just liked the idea of taken advantage of someone. Gross person. (Oh yeah, her yandere act stopped entertaining me after a few episodes)


Side characters- Only two out of the like 50 side characters were memorable: Uryuu Minene and Akise Aru. Though Uryuu was a pretty chill and cool person, there were some things about her that I never understood. Like becoming friends with the person who took out her left eye. They basically tried to make her into a basic textbook tsundere which I thought was a bit disappointing. She's still one of my faves nonetheless. But Akise Aru was such a good character. He deserved more screen time than anyone. He was clever and mysterious and just such a good character. He wasn't really relatable just like everyone else in the series, but how interesting he was was more than enough to make him likable. Everyone else wasn't really likable or memorable, and although a lot of them had tragic stories in order for them to maybe be memorable, they weren't. One question I had though was why they never focused on Eleven--the creator of the whole future diary idea. He was important as hell, yet he didn't get as much screentime as needed.


Enjoyment-4

The beginning was a bit interesting, but everything became such a mess as it went on. The end was interesting, but it was such bullshit that they had to make an OVA a year later to finally calm everyone down. I still wasn't satisfied.


Overall-2

I would never recommend this to someone. I'm not that cruel to do that...even if i hated them. This anime is not worth anyone's time...unless you love yanderes and useless characters and fillers then go ahead and be my guest.

The Future Diary (Mirai Nikki) is one hell of a crazy and entertaining ride. But only as long as you don't look at it too closely, because you'll notice many flaws if you do.
Characters - 7
The main character, 14 year old Yuki, is such a wimp that he makes Shinji Ikari look manly and heroic by comparison. But he's okay otherwise. I can think of a lot more annoying main characters.
The real star of the show is Yuki's overly attached girlfriend Yuno. She's smart, resourceful and completely unpredictable. And for some reason, she's madly in love with Yuki (pun intended).
The main characters and their relationshipdevelop over the course of the show. Yuki gets less wimpy, and Yuno gets... even more insane. There's also a wide variety of interesting and not-so-interesting side characters. Revy from Black Lagoon plays a crazy terrorist bomber and Kaworu from Evangelion plays an amateur detective.\n\n
Story - 6\n
The premise of this show is great. 12 players are selected to participate in a battle royale and given various devices that can predict the future. The winner of the game gets to become the GOD OF THE NEW WORLD (read in a dramatic voice of Light Yagami). But the execution of this idea is not that great. While the overarching story is great, there are plot holes galore and the characters are sometimes made to take unbelievably stupid actions in order to advance the plot or prevent the plot from taking an udesirable path. Also, the future-telling diaries are not really used to their full potential.\n
As a side note, I feel the need to say that the police in this show are utterly useless. They completely ignore every murder that occurs and sometimes even cooperate with known criminals for their own personal.. wait, maybe this isn't such an unrealistic show after all.\n\n
Art & Sound - 9\n
The character designs are nice (except the mother from the orphanage - what the hell was that?). The animation is good and the action scenes look great. Just a warning (or maybe an incentive): there is a lot of graphic violence and shameless fanservice.\n
The music was great and really helped in creating the right atmosphere when it needed to. The first opening was especially awesome.\n\n
Enjoyment - 9\n
If you can overlook the plot holes and Yuki's constant crying and Yuno yelling 'Yuki!' every 10 seconds, you should be able to enjoy this show, because it has almost every possible ingredient to make it fun and enjoyable to watch: plenty of action, crazy and shocking plot twists, lots of horror and suspense, interesting and non-conventional romance and... you know - Yuno.

I find the best animes are the ones where you want to see how it ends but you really dont want to see it end. This is the feeling i had through out Mirai Nikki. I was excited for the ending but was crushed that such a great show had to end. This review is not meant to spoil any of the story and its purpose is to only convince you to watch this show.
I've seen more than my fair share of bad reviews on Mirai Nikki and they bring up a lot of good points. It has more than its fair share of plotholes, characters do unexpected things that seem to happen unexplained and possibly out of order. But i believe if you look past all these plot holes you get a great show, love story (Sort of) and an amazing character in Yuno. Some endings seem forced but despite all that i fricken loved this show. I loved the story of Yuno and Yukki and i even love all the little thing about the other characters. Sometimes it feels like Yuno is carrying this show on her back but thats okay considering she is one of the most unique characters i have seen in anime and may go down as one of my favorite anime characters of all time.


This show kept drawing me back in with insane plot twists and i just needed to know what would happen next and most of all what would happen with our main characters relationship. Yes, this anime is full of plot holes but despite all that this was one of the most enjoyable rides i had and i certainly wont forget it. TBH i wish there could be more but there isnt very much else to do with this show. I highly recommend giving Mirai Nikki a try and just forget about whats wrong and focus what is great about this story.


PS: If you want a happy after its all over dont forget to watch Mirai Nikki Redial!

Overall, I rate this a 10/10 if I could, I would rate it 1,000,000 out of 10. It's truly a masterpiece. I recommend it.

You see to me, anime was Dragonball Z, Speed Racer, Yu Gi Oh! etc. A bunch of anime for kids that adults could also enjoy. I mean before a few years ago I was pretty ignorant when it came to anime, I  grew older and the biggest mystery to me in life was why I actually worshipped Pokemon.It was childish and as I was well into puberty I thought that maybe there has to be something better Japanese animation has to offer. Don't get me wrong, I like Dragon Ball Z but it didn't get to watch anime. It has its flaws like being really repetitive and having a group characters with constiaption, but I like the mindless fun. That's not to say I can't like other genres of this type of animation.


I still watch shonen anime like Naruto and Bleach, but Future Diary is something special.I saw the subbed version of this show. The show is a combination of action adventure, psychological thriller has bits of comedy, and can be seen as a tragedy for a lot of the characers. The show has amazing character development, a story so engaging it will keep you glued to your television screen, incredible voice acting and much more. I will try to go through what makes this show so incredible one by one and what, if an any, can be improved.


STORY AND SETTING(Contains Minor Spoilers):

The story kicks off with a girl being brutally murdered and a girl trying to revive a boy. This should tell you that this show will have a lot af violence and killing. The story then takes us to present day Japan where a boy named Yukiteru (our protaganist) is shown to be a solitary person. He keeps to himself and has almost no friends. He rather spends his time typing everything he sees into his diary.  His only friend is the imaginary god of space and time Deus Ex Machina who he talks to in his bedroom. One day Yukki sees his diary entris are already written down and everything that happens is written down in his cellphone.Yukki suspects Deus has something to do with this and it turns out Deus is not that imaginary. Deus forces Yuki to take part in a 12 man battle royale fight to the death. The diary of each participant now has the abilty to predict the future each with it's own benifits and weaknesses. The diary must be used by particiapants to kill each other with the winner being Deus' successor as god of space and time. You already have to be itching to see this if you have not already.I thought that it would be a lot like Death Note because of the concept te be a able to predict a future death but this show takes an old idea and makes it its own and Future Diary can even give Death Note a run for it's money. The writing for this series is razor sharp and the show never loses any steam during the 26 episode run. I have to admit that the show only really pulled me in with the second episode . The modern setting makes it accessible and watchable for a lot of people since a bunch of viewers don't like space westerns, period pieces or post apoctolyptic  shows. The show is full of twist and surprises. There is also a romantic subplot which a guy like me, who does not really care for romance enjoyed. Some people think that the ending was abrupt but I thought it was perfect. If you have a problem with it, read the manga or google the ending.


STORY AND SETTING; 10/10


ART:

The art of this show is incredible. Each character has their own look with different facial expressions and details, their own outfits which really looks like something you can buy from any store. The backgrounds and landscapes  are clear, whether it is water or grass. The houses,cars and buildings look amazing,some would say this is just really bright live action objects. Just one example of how beautiful this show is is to look at the sunset. Jim Carrey could not have said it better : B-E-A-UTIFUL. There is some CGI in here which can turn off some viewers, but it actually grew on me. It is just one character and one environment so you don't have to worry if it's not your cup of Pepsi. One more thing, the cellphones, the diaries, it really looks like the animators put real effort into designs and layout.  One of the best art out there.


ART 10/10


SOUND:

Another highlight if this show is the hypnotic sound. No voice is out of place, villian,good guy, fat lady, fat guy all whose voices fit like "like a glove"-Jim Carrey. The sound apart from the story to me is the make or break factor for an anime series. The voice actors convey incredible emotion with just a voice and they obtain what they set out to achieve. If the character should be rooted for, hated, likeable or felt sorry for,this is exactly what happens. Yukki can come off as annoying and whiney but it's all part of the way he matures throughout the series. The instrumentals played throughout the series makes you want to cry if something sad is playing when someone is dying or when something heroic plays you actually get goosebumps. My eyes were watering of excitement when something really badass happened. How good must the music be to make you feel like that. Really Motherloving good! The opening and ending theme songs of Future Diary are are catchy, upbeat, and just plain first-rate. The shows contains two opening songs and two ending songs with my personal favourites being the first ending theme and second opening theme both having a fast tempo and are really feel good songs. The first ending theme sounds like Japanese pop and the second opening is more of rock n roll but both are very good. The other two are not bad either.The first opening sounds like classical mixed with pop and the second ending theme falls more under soft rock. Incredible voice acting, songs that fit the tone of the show perfectly,this really is possibly the show's greatest asset.


SOUND 10/10


CHARACTER:

I can't give this part a perfect score because there are like two contestants that you dont get to know as well as the other players and this agitated me because every other contestant gets their chance to shine. However every other character has  great character development with distinct personalities and qualities, there are even characters that are not part of the game that you begin to care for and learn to love. The main character Yukiteru, matures a lot through this show as I stated above. He is a unique main character, because he has his flaws. He doubts himself, and doesn't want to be god at the beginning of the story. He is not a fighter but bit by bit comes to terms with his situation and knows that he is a participant for a reason. Yuno who  is a smoking hot red head teen girl who has strong feelings for Yukiteru, is my favourite character on the show. She would do anything to protect Yukki, and is the most mysterious person in the game. Her actions ,her lack of mercy for other players , her abilities, she really  is a stand out character here.She plays major parts in the twists that occur,in the biginning, middle, end and everything inbetween of the series. Yuno is the the character that makes the story even more thrilling and epic than it already is. There are so many more characters but I'm really scared that if I summarise them it would take away the suspense and mind games that makes up this show.The other 10 contestants first appear as silhouttes when Deus first calls them together to explain the game so you don't know they are.Silouhettes + Mysterious characters=Guy biting nails. I'll just say there are killer and non-killers, lovers,terrorists,cops who all have their own reasons for wanting to be god. So with the exception of about two characters, everyone has a backstory. The non-contestant characters all three dimensional and are all believable. Friends or foes, all people that grab your attention. There is also a lot of moral abiguity because alliances can be formed and then be broken just like that. The acting of the characters, their facial expresions, everything is really good.


CHARACTER 9/10


ENJOYMENT:

This was as I said my gateway anime. After I saw this I wanted to learn more about Japan. I want to do Judo,I want to learn Japanese,I want to create a cartoon show similar to anime, and I know who Steve Blum and Akira Kurosawa is. This is that good. Violence,suspense,twists,subtle humour, I love this show and after this I'm going to watch Great Teacher Onizuka and Full Metal Alchemist all thanks to this gem, this piece of art. I'm not overselling this series,it really is incredible and even though I'm a casual fan and have only seen a handful of anime, I recommend this to a person who is a fan of any genre of anime or even if you are not an anime fan and just want to watch a a spectacular tv show.And please don't forget to comment.


ENJOYMENT 10/10


OVERALL 10/10

If we exclude the *wierd* genre this is the craziest mainstream anime.
There are plot holes and characters do behave strangely but it is impossible to leave this series in between. I would definitely recommend this to people looking for romantic anime with overly attached girlfriend, same way I would recommend Higurashi to people looking for a cute kids show.

Ok, before I start, I want to say that this is all my opinion, which you may or may not agree with. I am aware that everyone does not think like I do and there will be controversy, but to be fair you should respect my opinion as I am not forcing you to think like I am and this is just a review. Thanks :)
Mirai Nikki... I will start of by saying this: amazing character design, fair enough visuals, and a good story, combined with good sounds. You may think that I very well enjoyed this anime.... Well if you did, I am sadto say that you are wrong. You may ask why, and I shall tell you with my heart: I extremely dislike Yuno! Why? Well, because of Yuno, she managed to ruin the plot, character design and my overall enjoyment. I will explain more as I review the rest of the aspects of the anime.


Story & plot: 

Positives: Although the story is not overall original, as it was very much similar to Deadman Wonderland... The plot I may say, was very original and very intriguing as well. Every episode I was very interested to see what would happen next as each episode builds up with the "juicy stuff" and the twists and turns in the plot. Therefore, many things were unexpected , as the situation increases, and that is what makes the anime so enjoyable.

Negatives: The negatives actually overshadow the positives and that is because of one reason, for which I will get to. But, I would start of with the episodes near the end of the series; the anime tried very hard to build up the drama in each episode and tried to make it more complex. Although they somewhat achieved this, it also left with many plot holes which simply overshadow the complexity that the makers of the anime where trying to achieve. Also, including near the end, because of the plot holes, the plot simply diverged into two plots being a deathmatch survival game and a Yandere bullcrap thing. Because of the Yandere bullcrap thing, the anime gets ruined with the unnecessary scenes of "love" which made me barf. Without the Yandere bullcrap thing, the anime could've advanced in the story with less polt holes and more complexity without having to include unnecessary scenes. Oh yeah did I mention the ending is rubbish? The Yandere crap also helped made the character design fail as well.


Character design:

Positives: Mirai Nikki had one of the best character designs of all time, which eventually breaks down during near the end of the series. Characters are all very intriguing with their own backgrounds, morals, and goals. Each character also has their very own "voice" and are all very diverse with interesting personalities. Throughout the show, characters also develop more, and change sometimes their views. So, unlike most anime, the characters only become better and better as you learn more about them. The anime, being so that it has a diverse range of characters, it gives the viewer a chance to "bond" with a certain character.

negatives: Throughout the show, being so that all the characters are so different, and some don't get enough scene time, and your favorite character may only last for so long... it is very unfortunate when your favorite character dies, since no one else can replace them.... Next, because the plot diverges into two separate plots, many once was important characters become no longer important as they seem to be discarded without a good end to any of them

which makes the only two "important characters" currently existing are: Yuno and Yuki. Because of that, all of the feeling and whatnot the other characters had, are now deemed to be nothing. The only relationships that the main character has now, is with Yuno. Where did all the other characters go?! The main character also changes into being a retarded f***! 


Everything else was fine enough, and wasn't very interesting to review on, as they are not bad nor too good. Therefore, this brings my call to action... Please, destroy the love relationship between Yuno and Yuki and change it to a friendly one. Although many people think that it drives the plot, there only has to be a slight fixture which everything else can still be the same. If Yuno and Yuki only had a friendly relationship, then the plot can remain fairly the same, only less disgustingly exaggerated, and with way less plot holes which makes the ending better. This can also change the character design; since Yuki and Yuno's relationship isn't that significant anymore, other characters can now be more important and the main character doesn't have to be a snot. I also won't be disgusted with the "love scenes" (they are definitely not pretty). Oh yeah, remember that horrible ending I said earlier? Yeah, with the "love" being replaced with friendship, the ending would be much better.


Final Verdict: Normally I would probably give the anime a 1/10 as I was disgusted and pissed off throughout the anime. But, if the "love" can just be friendship, then I will give the anime: 7.12/10

*spoilers* yes, spoilers.
Just hearing the name "Mirai Nikki" sends a shiver up my spine, the best way to describe such a show is fucked up. Girls going from cute loli princesses, into evil High-School girls that have nothing better to do than rip each other apart. Put aside the fact that everything is extremely unrealistic and makes absolutely no sense whatsoever, and you've got "Mirai Nikki", another Romantic, Psychological Thriller that's better than twilight.
Usually I set up my reviews in sections, but this time i thought "Fuck it". Lets begin.
Lets get out the way and just point out that the art and sound art good.Nothing really to review here as it's everyone's separate opinion.


Now, before you continue this review there is a question I've got to ask you. 


Do you like to be mindfucked so hard that you don't understand what the fuck is going on?


If you answered yes to that question, you may as well just start the anime now because that was my initial feeling during the time spent watching.


Mirai Nikki, an anime that for some reason I honestly don't understand, I love. The sheer amount of mindfuckery in this anime is enough to make a man explode in confusion and call the police for mental harassment. I never understood how the god of time was his dream and then real and fuck me it made no sense. I also didn't understand how they got the phones in the first place? Whatever, I might just have forgotten. Who gives a shit about the story? We got to see a cute girl go mental and kill shit. 


The characters you may ask? The main guy was a prick, but Yuno made up for him. Yukiteru, or as Yuno commonly referred to him "Yuki!" was one of my least favourite characters of anime, ever. Until around the end when he decided to grow a fucking pair, he couldn't do shit for himself and made Yuno do everything. Thank god for that, if he'd tried to do something he would of died, instantaneously leaving a quick end. I found the other characters (1-12) pretty average. Other than Uryuu, nothing special. Uryuu was a good character, i just didn't understand what the fuck happened with her eventually. She went insane again after calming her tits and tried to kill Yuki? If only she had succeeded, what a shame. 


Here for the biggest and bulkiest part of the review? The part that everyone scrolls down because they don't have the time and effort to look through? Kick your feet up, sip on that mountain dew and prepare for a long block of text you honestly couldn't be fucked to read.


The Enjoyment.


Well, as a start I can guess I can say I "Enjoyed" Mirai Nikki. The fight's where pretty cool, and some of the characters on their own where even cooler. It had a good idea behind it, i just think it should've been explained better. I also think that they should've used a better main character, for instance one with balls. Though, I thought the whole Yuno protecting Yuki thing was pretty cool, i've still got to mention the fact that it would've been better if Yuki could man the fuck up and do something useful. He was literally just a 100KG Stone that Yuno had to get on her knees and drag along the plot. I loved the art, I thought the dead bodies that Yuno hid looked pretty sick and the characters themselves looked well-drawn. I'm trying not to drag this review along much longer as I wouldn't want to make it painfully long to read, so the best way to put this anime is a better version of guilty crown.


Final Conclusion: 

This show was pretty satisfying. If you're used to all the rom-com stuff, I'd strap on your seatbelt, put your dick back in your pants, and take this for a ride.


Oh yeah, and for those who wanted scores:


Story: 6

Art: 8

Sound: 7

Character: 8

Enjoyment:8

Overall: 8

Lets be honest. If you gave this a 10 (like I did), its either because you have been in a similar relationship as Yuki, you're in one right now, or hell, you long for a relationship like that! 
If Yuno is a 10, as far as crazy goes, my relationship in real life was like a 5 because lets be honest no one in real life could get away with what happens in this anime. I'm simply referring to the psychological state that Yuno/my ex possessed. 
As Chris Tucker would say "We coulda had something special... but you're one crazy ass bitch!" 
In all honestyI can see how this is a love it or hate it type of anime. In my book this is a masterpiece because it was so relatable, but it may be different for you. Just know that this anime does have some dark moments that really make your stomach turn.

--WARNING-- (This does contain a few spoilers, because it was hard not to put any in.)  
I told myself I would never write a review for this anime simply because almost everything that I would type out would be negative. Now here I am.
  I feel like I more or less should warn people who were as naive as me. I started this anime with high hopes and perhaps to see something that I had never before seen. While the concept was amazing, I don't feel they took it in the right direction.
  I'm not going to sit here andgive you a run down of the whole anime because you really can look anywhere to find the story. But the bottom line is it was just an utter disappointment.


  I came upon this anime by accident, but the idea of a survival game using cell phones and this fascinating girl known as "Yuno" captivated me. The first episode went by in what felt like less than ten minutes and I thought I was going to fall absolutely in love. The episodes when on and I found myself becoming more and more interested, but at about ten that all came crashing down.


  I started to dislike it bit by bit. It began with Amano "Yuki" Yukiteru believing he was falling in love with Yuno. I myself couldn't feel pity for her, not with her stalker mentality and psychotic tendancies. He himself said she was crazy in the beginning and that he wouldn't get involved, but somehow or another he was able to completely throw that aside to give himself to her. How..how do you look past something like that?


  Many people apparently do pity Yuki for ending up in the game at all, but I can't. I just can't. He made his bed and he ended up having to lie down in it.


  In the end he turned into this complete brat who was willing to twist the entire world just to be with this insane girl and have his parents back. He even shot his friends who only wanted to help him and make him see what was really going on.


  I will admit I loved characters such as Akise and Minene, but they only got so much screen time. It's honestly sad when you find yourself hating the two main characters in the end and wanting/begging for them to die.


  I didn't get my wish. The final episodes were what made me score this anime the way I am. I found Yuki to be irritating, Yuno to be too obsessive, and parts of this whole thing to be pointless.


  I wish it had gone in a better direction, because this "love story" just wasn't worth it.

Well where can I start? After watching Mirai Nikki I have to say its my favorite anime up to date, so you know this is going to be a positive review :)
Story: 9
The story is absolutely great !The story Is a psychotic love thriller focusing on the two main characters Yukki and Yuno with tons of great supporting characters, a fast paced plot, a LOT of murder and gore, a plot twist that you'll never see coming, and an ending that'll leave you in tears. There are no filler episodes or any that feel that they didn't serve a purpose, and above all they wereall extremely enjoyable. The only problems that I have with the story which are minor are that at certain points, specifically in between episodes the story can feel disjointed like as if you missed something, and there is one plot hole that I found once I had finished the series.


Art: 10

The Animation is simply superb, the characters are all nicely animated and crisp and the art style, especially in the Yuno Physco scenes are done perfectly, and Yukki's reaction to them is done great as well.


Sound: 9 

Okay seriously you know an opening theme is good when I, someone who usually always skips over the op of most animes watches it every episode, even in the middle of a 7 episode marathon. The first opening theme is my second favorite opening theme of any anime behind Cowboy Bebop's, it just fits Mirai Nikki so Perfectly. The ending songs of both season are good as well, the only bad thing is the second opening theme is kind of lame.


Character: 10

 Yukki the main male  lead is pretty much a big wimp which may turn off some people but it worked for the show I think, and his few redeeming moments (and by that i mean when he isn't crying behind Yuno and he actually does something heroic) were amazingly satisfying to say the least. Now the real star of the show is Gasai Yuno, The main female lead. She can go from being the cutest and sweetest girl you've ever seen to being a completely psychotic lunatic then next. Literally there will be points where you'll be like "Holy crap what a crazy B!*ch!!" she's whats really gets you to watch more, you'll always be wonder what Yuno's gonna do next. The character development of Yukki is greatly done, and Yuno's back story is just amazing. 


Enjoyment: 10

If you enjoy action, great characters, a good love story, a jaw dropping plot twist, and don't mind some gore then Mirai Nikki is the show for you! Now do yourself a favor and watch this phenomenal amine!

This was a such a great anime! I loved the twists and turns. 
I watched this in about 4 days so I really experienced it real time. 
I loved the supernatural and psychological elements to this anime. I also enjoyed all of the different sets of characters of the phone holders.
Because of the length of this anime, it allowed it to really have a meaty story and allow for great character development. I had some characters that I really liked that I hated in the beginning. 
After I saw this anime, I was really exhausted in a good way. I couldn't believe the places thatthis series went. Bravo!\n\n
I thought the OVA was very worthy and the ending was super satisfying. \n\n
Watch it!

Future Diary... Well... This anime is very popular for what I think is the wrong reason. If someone told you to watch it, their reasoning for saying so is because they most likely love the character Yuno Gasai. In my opinion, she was a biatch who was obsessed with this one guy.
The story was pretty good. Kind of reminded me of The Hunger Games because... It was basically the same thing except you're God if you win.  I found this concept to be interesting seeing as to the fact that I never got why anyone would want to be God. (8/10)
The art is somethingthat I really did like about this show. Just... the way the hair was drawn and the eyes... made it really enjoyable experience. And the way that the blood was drawn... That was very nice. (10/10)


The sound was great to. I for one, watched it in Japanese, and I think the voice actors were very fitting. The music well... I really did like the track this show had to offer. The sad track was very pretty and I often find myself listening to it. (9/10)


The characters were overall, very interesting. Although I don't get why people would ever like her, Yuno was an interesting character. She is quite... well, insane but for good reason. There were lots of characters, all of them creepy in their own special way. (10/10)


My enjoyment of this show was.... Very good. It had a good amount of gore, sadness, and even it's share of romance. (8/10)


Overall I would rate this show as very good. The whole idea of the show got me thinking how far I would go for someone else.

In my opinion; I personally love Mirai Nikki. However, I can see the flaws in it. 
First the story. It's fairly original and its unique *to my knowledge* however, it does seem to be a little rushed when it comes to certain antagonists. 
The art is decent and it can look rather beautiful at times.
The opening's for this anime is amazing. It can capture you and get you to sing along and the scenes often have a beautiful soundtrack to match scenes. 
The characters are fairly rounded. They all have unique personalities and each one adds on to the stories plot and has unique interactions.\n
Overall I believe this is great; however, it does have its flaws.

Mirai Nikki is a chilling masterpiece that integrates the themes of death, violence and power into its story amazingly, MN specialises in its ability to play with the idea of how people can do horrible things when faces with the reward of power, it delves into the human psyche better than any other anime could, The animation is outstanding and blew me away from start to finish, the characters are all unique in their own way and written masterfully, the show had me engaged and on the edge of my seat through the whole running time, i highly recommend this masterpiece for anyone looking fora watch that will effect the way they view anime.

Mirai Nikki is kind of amazing. Not because it's good, but because it it does so much wrong all at once that it baffles me. Typically, bad or subpar anime only indulge in a few major "anime tropes" at a time. Even my ultimate nemesis Sword Art Online (which I still think was a worse experience than this one) does not throw as much shit into its story. Meanwhile, Mirai Nikki seems to have every anime trope in the book, and that too, bad ones. Cliche ones. Embarrassing ones that make anime fans go "but wait, anime is not just porn!" Mirai Nikki goes aboveand beyond by having them all. It's an exercise in stupidity. A cacophony of nonsense.


For that reason alone, I'd say it's worth one (just a single) watch. Lessons can be learned from this shitshow of a trainwreck. You could call Mirai Nikki "How Not to Make a Good Anime" because this is one the medium's low points. And yet, this has over an 8 on MAL, is #9 of the most popular anime, and Yuno Gasai is the #1 most favorited female character of all time. Well... there's no accounting for taste. Also, I think my mindset before going into this anime really helped. I knew or at least suspected it was going to be terrible, so my expectations didn't let me down. I don't think I quite consider it a "so bad it's good" thing because there's a distinct lack of charm or appeal for me, but it wasn't totally unwatchable either. Aside from a few filler episodes, the pacing is very fast, so I didn't start getting bored until the end. There were some moments that were unintentionally hilarious too, so at least I got a laugh out of it sometimes. I'm sure it would've been really frustrating if I came into it thinking it'd be decent or good, but thankfully I didn't.


Normally at this point in the review, I would be rambling and nitpicking every little thing that bothered me about the anime, but what do I say when literally almost everything is bad? Frankly, I don't even want to go back and think about it anymore than I already have. In fact, it's actually easier if I just named the few things I liked: 1] there's a few voice actors I happen to really like (Akira Ishida, Norio Wakamoto, Tomokazu Seki, Takehito Koyasu), and 2] Aru Akise is pretty much the only decently written and likable character of the cast. That's it. Honestly, I saw this anime because I can't help but watch the really popular stuff to see what the fuss is about. Now that I've ticked it off, I'm officially done. This review is me metaphorically washing my hands of it. 


(You know, if the author really wanted to make a story with jiggly boobs, the gang rape of teen girls, and 14 year olds having sex, he could've just made a hentai. I would've respected that far more, just saying.)

CONTAINS NO SPOILERS
OVERALL 9/10
Even if the art and characters could have been better, it was forgivable due to the story's premise, plot, and twists. I highly recommend this for thriller nuts and sci-fi lovers out there. I you are not used to gore and blood, you may back out on this one.
STORY AND PLOT 10/10
The story is mind boggling. Twist of events will blow you away. The premise was clear and intriguing, and world laws and settings were presented just right.
ART 7/10
The art was good, but not that outstanding.
CHARACTER 6/10
Some characters turned out to be likable. However, in the anime, most characters were not roundcharacters. They did not develop into better characters every episode, instead an abrupt change were imposed in the last episodes of the series. Characters were not presented in more depth, and I could have wished for a clearer presentation of motives, background, and psychology of the characters. Side characters seemed to me as wallflowers.\n\n
ENJOYMENT 10/10\n
If you like thrillers, Mirai Nikki has it all.\n\n

If that anime is not a 10/10 one, then I don't know what may be!

All of the characters have a different story and a different goal, which makes the stoy more interesting.

This is my first review for an anime since I believe this one deserves it.
When my friends begged me to watch this show I hesitated. I looked at some of the reviews on this site and they were pretty mixed. I decided to watch it anyway and i'm glad I did, here's why.
Firstly, the music. if you've heard the first opening to this show you'll know what i'm talking about. There is some great music in here, although some tracks I couldn't quite latch onto. Especially the second opening, which instead of not skipping like I did while binge watching the first half, didn't wantto sit through. I would've liked it better if they kept the first opening through the whole series, it might be just me though.


Next, art. It's great. although there are a few minor cases of the anime bad cgi disease commonly seen throughout most modern shows. It might be jarring at first, but as the series went on I just grew accustomed to it. Other than the cg, the character designs are (and the food) pretty detailed.


With characters, it's a mixed bag. Some characters had me actually care about their well being, such as Minene, Nishijima, Akise, and Yuno. Yukki is what makes this a mixed bag. He's just a wuss. He's the type of person who needs people to do things for him, and in my opinion that's not how a main character should be. Despite this I still enjoyed watching what unfolded even if Yukki seemed to hold some things back.


Finally, I want to touch on the story. I personally loved it. The concept of a diary that tells the future sounded like a super cool idea. The story actually made me feel emotions of happiness, sadness, and disgust (people with hemophobia might wanna stay away from this show). Some parts had me at  the edge of my seat and always made me want to go one more episode in. I never felt that the story dragged at any time. Something was always happening.


Sorry if this sounds a little bare-bones, i'll work hard to try and make better reviews in the future. Thanks for reading!
